Reviews.Title: “Great, as expected”
Reviews.Author: John177
Reviews.Content: Hotel Burnham delivers what you expect of a Kimpton hotel - helpful staff, comfortable room, beautiful public spaces, and a nice location. Service was cordial and competent throughout my stay. Check-in was easy and fast. I forgot a couple items, mentioned it to housekeeping, and they were at my door within minutes. Bellmen were quick to give tips and directions. Room was comfortable. It might have felt tight with two people, worked fine solo. Wifi is a nice benefit of being part of the Kimpton Plus program. Of course, it was clean. Public spaces are beautiful. Burn ham is a landmark building, well restored. The Atwood feels like a classic downtown restaurant, fun bar, and accommodating to solo visitors. Fitness room isn't much, a few tired machines in a small space. If a health club is important to you, probably better to go with one of the chains. Location works for business and touring around. It's a few blocks' walk to into the financial district. Heading in the opposite direction, you hit the lake and Millennium Park, and just south of there, the Art Institute. Terrific running for miles along the water. All worked for me. But I can see someone wanting to stay near Watertower Place, Michigan Ave. shopping, and Rush Street saying Burnham's too long a hike, and picking a place north of the Loop. Same as all Kimpton hotels, Burnham is a good deal. Not a budget place, but less than the chains, and way less than the super-luxury places. I liked it a lot, and will stay on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “First come first served.. Even with reservations..REALLY ..SERIOUSLY!!!”
Reviews.Author: curly-Q28
Reviews.Content: What a terrible experience we had at the Burnham Hotel Chicago. We booked a room with two queen beds over two weeks in advance. when we arrived at the hotel we were told that policy is "first come, first serve" and all they had left was a small single! WHAT! Thats crazy. They already took the money out of our account two weeks prior when we booked the room. We were told there was a room with two queens available at that time. What's the purpose of a reservation if you don't get the room you requested. The people at front desk seemed to think that was perfectly ok to to give our room away and not even offer any compensation or even assistance finding us alterative accomadations. Consenquintly , we had to scramble around Chicago to find a another room to accomadate the rest of our party. Terrible customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Chicago History !”
Reviews.Author: MaryanneHumphrey
Reviews.Content: My husband found this hotel and we have stayed there a couple of times thus far. The building is awesome - you can see pictures of the refurbishing and we are so glad they saved this Chicago Landmark !! The hotel is in a great location which allows you to walk almost anywhere in the city you want to go. The rooms are nice, clean, and the service at the hotel is excellent. Every waitress/waiter, front desk people, room service, all of the "service" people are extremely friendly and helpful. You get the idea they like their jobs, and who wouldn't ?

Reviews.Title: “This Boutique Hotel is a Keeper”
Reviews.Author: Doymo
Reviews.Content: I had never heard of this hotel or the Kimpton Chain until my girlfriend booked it for a girls' weekend. It is very well located and oozes charm. The staff bends over backward to make you feel welcome and comfortable. There is a beautiful restaurant in the lobby. The food is delicious. The rooms are spotless and beautifully appointed. I will definitely be staying there again and joined their preferred program so I can enjoy their hotels in different states.

Reviews.Title: “Finally stayed at the Burnham”
Reviews.Author: alwoh
Reviews.Content: We had wanted to stay at this hotel for some time - prices often more than we wanted to pay. On a special deal weekend, we finally enjoyed this unique landmark hotel. The staff was very friendly - best bellhop ever - gave us the full history of the place on the way to our room. Room was very small, but appointments up to the usual Kimpton standards. The location is excellent for walking to many of Chicago's attractions and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “You must be kidding.”
Reviews.Author: kromsky
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the reviews on Trip Advisor, and all I can say is that I will be much more circumspect about believing those reviews in future. In this case, in particular, I have to believe that employees of the Kimpton chain have been posting these reviews about the great service at this hotel. I stayed here for four nights and it was one of the worst serviced hotels of my experience. The room was not well maintained and not clean enough. On the first day I was there, even though I put a please clean my room notice on the door, it was not serviced at all. On that same first day, I called for breakfast room service and was told they had no cereal. On another day, it took me 45 minutes and three phone calls to get a juice and a pot of coffee for breakfast. There was a lovely young man at reception who appeared to be constantly on duty. In other words, the hotel was woefully understaffed. I would never go there again. Beware of these reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, beautiful hotel, a pleasure to spend there your vacation”
Reviews.Author: Adinuk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Burnham with my husband and my daughter for a night in February We absolutely loved the room! It's just so quaint and the view was amazing! The staff is very attentive, we got a crib for my baby and because of that, we all got a great night sleep! The check in/ out process was very smooth and fast, that's what I like!!! The free coffee in the morning is a nice touch I highly recommend hotel Burnham to anyone that wants to stay downtown and wants to enjoy a historical building! What a perfect experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Burnham”
Reviews.Author: enroute1234
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel in an excellent location with fine service and a very good restaurant. The only drawback are the somewhat small rooms. The hotel is a retrofitted landmark office building, and the rooms reflect the small rooms of the former offices, but they're very comfortable, wityh big windows and well-outfitted bathrooms. Perks include morning coffee in the lobby and wine in the late afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NanciAnne
Reviews.Content: There can be no better location in Chicago!! This hotel is in the heart of the City, just a few blocks from the famed Millennium Park, fabulous shopping, tons of activities, the Chicago Cultural Center (visitors center), and bus tours. Our room was lovely. The building was not originally a hotel, so many of the room are a bit oddly shaped. It adds - not detracts from the charm. There is a wonderful restaurant on the first floor. The staff was awesome!!! Valet parking with full in-and-out options was just $50 per night (cheap by city standards). We also loved the morning coffee in the lobby and the 5:30 p.m. free wine party. This is just a wonderful gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great Mid-grade hotel in heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTrekker1971ORD
Reviews.Content: This is an old historic building that was completely rehabbed a few years ago. The lobby, elevators and hallways still have the charm of the original building, but the rooms have been completely upgraded to include all of the modern comforts. The rooms are not huge but they have everything you need. The views are good. I think the best thing overall about this hotel was the staff. They were extremely friendly and helpful and not in an odd or intrusive way. There is complimentary wine each evening, however the wine is just average - but again it is free. There is also free starbucks coffee in the mornings. I think this is a great hotel for a short stay. It is located right off of the subway line that leads to O'Hare and 1 short block from the orange subway line that leads to Midway airport. If you don't want to splurge for the Peninsula or Elysian in Chicago this is a good option. I would probably opt for this hotel over the Hiltons, Sheratons, or Hyatts in town - although I have stayed at some of these in Chicago and they are not too bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Old School Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Shera34
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night in February as I was in town to see a show at the Oriental Theater nearby. This hotel is in a fabulous location - across from the Macy's (former Marshal Fields) and very close to Michigan Ave. and many Theaters, bars and restaurants. We had a standard Queen Room, which was larger than I anticipated, with a very comfortable bed. I could not get my husband out of it the next morning - he kept saying that it was the most comfortable bed he had ever slept in! The design of the hotel is very unique and you feel like you are transported back into the 1920's, but with all of the amenities you would expect from a high end 4 star hotel. There is a gorgeous marble staircase near the elevators and I highly recommend checking out other floors. I took the elevator up to the top floor and then walked down the marble staircase as much as I could and i really enjoyed seeing each floor. I will certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Second time at the Burnham!”
Reviews.Author: Kcavs
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the Burnham for a long weekend in Chicago. It was once again great. We had an executive suite, which was ample size. Nice views...could even see part of the lake. The staff is very friendly and attentive. We didn't eat at the Atwood Cafe, but we did spend some quality time at the bar. The bartender is a cocktail genius. Ask for a lesson on gin! We look forward to coming back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful building, attentive service”
Reviews.Author: MKEShrink
Reviews.Content: Third time at Hotel Burnham. It's become a bit of a birthday tradition to go there. Rooms are beautiful. Location is perfect for seeing plays, etc. Staff always attentive. Valet parking ($50/night ~ unlimited in and out) was a bit rough. Service great. Will go back there again next year! Only complaint is that the bathroom is a bit out-dated.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: K L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the underground station, you can take the underground direct from O'Hare airport to the shopping centre, and take one minute to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: odle
Reviews.Content: Stayed two times within a 3 week period. Comfortable rooms, great Chicago architecture- but both times I was blown away but the fantastic customer service and delicious room service. Super nice staff-- and fresh and creative food that you would never get at a larger hotel. yum.

Reviews.Title: “A great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: MavenNyc
Reviews.Content: Whenever I'm in Chicago, this is my first choice for a hotel. The staff is always welcoming and the hotel has a number of little touches that make a routine business trip special. One of my favorite things is that they don't soak you (like some other hotels) for WiFi. The beds are comfortable and the restaurant downstairs is great.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Comfortable & Consistent”
Reviews.Author: rachel80
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at The Burnham for the past few years, both when passing through Chicago & enjoying a long weekend. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The staff is unbelievably friendly & we always feel at home here. We sometimes travel with our dog & this is the only hotel I would consider in that case. The location is wonderful, the Atwood serves good food & the overall feeling of the hotel is warm & welcoming. The rooms are always spotless & we always enjoy our time there. We loved it so much that we extended our stay an extra day over New Years weekend!

Reviews.Title: “A must for an architecture buff...”
Reviews.Author: MitchPNY
Reviews.Content: Four and half stars (I'm a very tough rater). Perfect location and a must for anybody interested in architecture. This was one of the first modern skyscrapers in the world. Maybe because this was Chicago in January, but the price (I thought) was more than reasonable for being smack-dead in the middle of the Loop. My room was very nice, although the view was nothing to speak of (but this is not a criticism. Every hotel has to have a few rooms without any view, and I opted for a reasonable price over a view). Certain floors (accessible to everyone) have lobby areas which show off the full display of original iron work. A walk down the interior stairs is a must!

Reviews.Title: “The clock stopped at The Burnham”
Reviews.Author: NPCerto
Reviews.Content: The Burnham is a treat, old style Chicago building in the Loop and close to businesses and entertainment. The restaurant and bar are superb (I am a fan of bloody marys and crabcakes). Its all cozy and warm without seeming small. I've stayed there about 5 times and keep going back. Superb service and...its pet friendly. Kind of nice to see a friendly pooch or two when I'm away from home.

Reviews.Title: “No Need To Look Elsewhere, Seriously.”
Reviews.Author: Renoyd
Reviews.Content: We live in Milwaukee and have visited Chicago for decades. This is one of the best possible locations - a few minutes walk from the Art Institute and Millennium Park, across the street from Macy's (Marshall Fields), short walk from Union Station, Navy Pier, Buddy Guy's, Magnificent Mile, Theater District, the EL, etc, etc. Small 16 floor hotel feels like home, very nice people, great little bar and restaurant and lobby with late afternoon wine tasting and interesting architectural history. Upgrading upon request no problem if availability, nice views, a first rate place overall at incredible pricing for such a location in Chicago, (You would pay more in Milwaukee!!). Business, anniversary, shopping trip, whatever, this is the place, no BS.

Reviews.Title: “SMOKERS BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: chppie
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL IF YOUR A SMOKER!!!!!! There was nothing posted that this is a non smoking facility. They charged us 500.00 cleaning fee!!!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kbr25
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only one night, but I was sorry it wasn't longer. This hotel is fabulous. All the staff, from the doorman to the front desk, were incredibly friendly, helpful, accommodating, and professional. My room (Queen Deluxe) was very attractive and comfortable, and I loved my view down onto the street (and at the Old Navy). I took advantage of the late afternoon wine reception, which was a very relaxing and elegant way to end my long day in Chicago. The Starbucks coffee the next morning also was a lovely touch. The lobby and the tile work leading to the stairs were beautiful. Because I was alone & traveling for business, I did not take advantage of the Atwood Cafe, which shares downstairs space with the hotel. It looked gorgeous, and I would have loved to eat there, but I couldn't justify splurging on a meal only to eat it alone in a nice upscale restaurant. I discovered, somewhat belatedly however, that almost right next door is a wonderful little Italian coffee joint/cafe, Lavazza. That was convenient and delicious. The location of the Hotel Burnham is also wonderful -- easy walk to the major sites downtown, and right around the corner from two El stops. I took the El from O'Hare and walked to the hotel -- it couldn't have been easier, and I am not very good at navigating urban transportation systems! My only complaint on the location front, and this was no fault of the hotel, was the group of "drummers" who had set up shop on the sidewalks in front of the Macy's. That incessant banging on plastic containers is fine if you hear it briefly as you pass by, but in my room that afternoon and evening, it was like the drums of hell, beating beating beating beating into my brain! Thank goodness they knocked it off around 9:00 before I lost my mind. I used the exercise room while I was there, too. This is always an important feature for me. I was impressed with the quality of the equipment: it was new and the same machines at my gym. Cardio equipment (except the bike) had tvs built into them, so bring your headphones. There were 2 treadmills, an elliptical trainer, and a Spin-style upright bike. There also were free weights and some bands and bosu balls, etc. Towels were provided, and they were fresh and clean; spring water & apples also were provided. The room itself, however, is quite small, so if were being used things might get cozy. I was the only one there for the hour I spent in the morning on Saturday, so I had it all to myself. All in all, I felt pampered and valued at the Hotel Burnham, and I had a fantastic stay. My expectations were exceeded. I wish I had more time to stay and visit Chicago. In fact, I enjoyed the hotel and the city so much, I do hope to come back again. One night and parts of 2 days really wasn't enough. If I return, then I absolutely, without doubt, will stay at the Hotel Burnham and would even arrange my trip around the availability of space at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the City”
Reviews.Author: GwenJay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Burnham during a recent business trip, and was so impressed by the staff. Our group was greeted warmly on arrival and given a run down of the offerings (including coffee in the AM and a number of items available if you forgot to pack them). Once in my room, I realized I needed some toothpaste and called the front desk. I was amazed to hear a knock on the door with the item seconds after the phone call ended! Every employee, from Ben at the front desk to Linda in security treated us fabulously. They even continued to provide above and beyond service after I checked out - we needed to check out via phone and have a colleague drop off the keys later (no problem!). I called for a copy of the folio the following week and Ben had it in my email box in minutes. The cafe attached to the lobby has fabulous food and a nice atmosphere to unwind - I especially loved the grown up mac and cheese! The regular rooms are a little on the small side, but I was so pleased with the service that I didn't mind at all.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch all the way around!”
Reviews.Author: CabValparaiso
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews I decided to reserve a room at the Hotel Burnham for my son and his wife's first anniversary. I can't begin to tell you how very helpful the hotel was in setting everything up!! The room they stayed in was gorgeous! It was a corner room on the historic 7th floor and they were both beyond thrilled with it! Martin Jimenez went well out of his way in sending restaurant recommendations and making reservations at the restaurant of my son's choice. He made sure everfhing was done exactly to my requests and even left a note for my son and his wife wishing them a happy anniversary since he was not working the night they stayed. They enjoyed drinks in the bar which were "on the house" as a special the hotel was running in December. They reported that the location was central to everything and they could easily walk everywhere, even in the cold winter of Chicago! I just want to say "thank you" again to Martin as well as everyone at the hotel. My son and his wife said everyone they encountered was so helpful and friendly and they had a stay they will never forget! This is where I plan to stay if I make an overnight trip to Chicago!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: go4north
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Burnham for a weekend during a recent visit to Chicago. It was our first stay there, and our first stay at a Kimpton Hotel. The staff was exceptional â€“ friendly, helpful, and prompt. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a suite with a beautiful view of State St. The ambience and architecture of the hotel are lovely. The rooms have stocked fridges and snacks. The bathrooms have Aveda products. The cafÃ© is beautiful, and while we just had a continental breakfast, even the fruit bowl was artfully presented. The hotel is within walking distance to just about anything in the downtown area. There is also a CTA bus stop directly across the street. What sets Hotel Burnham apart is the high level of customer service and the gorgeous building and dÃ©cor. Hotel Burnham is now our Chicago hotel of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, but disappointing service and bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Jami398
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Burnham is a charming hotel located on State and Washington Streets. The location is great for the Art Museum, Theatre District, and shopping. I was excited to experience a Kimpton, boutique hotel, but was disappointed in the overall service, and the bathroom in my suite. I stayed in a suite with a king-sized bed which was lovely, but the bathroom was small, and the shower did not work properly. I had constant problems with room service. The staff kept forgetting to bring food I ordered. Also, the staff at the front desk was not as friendly as I had expected. The "free" hot chocolate was never available when I went to the lobby. Overall, I did have a nice stay, but that was due more to the excitement of being in Chicago than the hotel. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel Box of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BerylMarkham56
Reviews.Content: I visited Chicago in October with my sister and we stayed four nights at this architecturally important and cozy boutique hotel. Service was warm and friendly and the location is perfect. The rooms, as other reviewers note, are a bit small, but they're well appointed and charming. The bottom-line judgment of a hotel or restaurant is, Would one stay there again? I definitely would. The Hotel Burnham is now my Chicago hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: cellapink
Reviews.Content: The Burnham is our first choice for overnights in Chicago. We live in the far suburbs and occasionally enjoy an overnight stay downtown. We love the Burnham's ideal location for theatre, shopping, and Millennium Park. Best of all are the friendly and accommodating staff. The rooms are not spacious, but well-appointed and meticulously decorated. The public spaces are cozy/trendy. I am not a fan of large hotels full of business travelers. The Burnham is perfect. I have stayed at other Kimptom properties and they are all top-notch.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: BretonFlightCentre
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and I have stayed in my fair share of hotels around the world. The Hotel Burnham is my new favorite. I had the pleasure to stay in a Executive suite with an amazing view of the Chicago Theatre and Macys and from the other side Millennium Park. The room was large for a boutique hotel with a separate living area. Bed was extremely comfortable. Everything from the Atwood Cafe, to the elevators to the opulent hotel lobby features the charm that Chicago is all about. Another huge bonus is the location of the Burnham. You are literally a stones throw from the Lake subway on the red line, another block to the blue line. You can get to either O'hare or Midway airport with ease using public transit if you wish. With the location and decor aside, the main part of this hotel that sets it apart is the service. Whatever we needed at the Hotel Burnham, we got. The front desk was sincere and helpful. The housekeeping staff left personal notes and did an excellent job cleaning up our suite. Everything from check in to check out had a personal touch that you just can't get at a Radisson or major hotel chain. My boyfriend and I both really enjoyed the nightly wine receptions. This hotel exceeds any experience I've had at a city hotel, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nutcracker Dreams”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQSB
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for one night during Christmas week to attend the Joffrey Ballet. My stay at the Burnham could not have been better. The front desk personnel greeted me warmly and gave me a $10 "raid the minibar" card when I checked in. My room was warm and comfortable and had the two amenities that I appreciate the most: a fridge and a bathrobe. They also have Aveda bath products--nice. I took advantage of the free wine reception in the lobby before I left for the ballet. On my departure morning, I ate in the on site Atwood Cafe for breakfast and was disappointed that, although it is quite expensive, the food is quite ordinary. (I've eaten dinner there before and thought it was good.) When I left, I used the blue line entrance across the street from the hotel to get to O'Hare, very convenient and costs only $2.25. The Burnham is a perfect Chicago loop hotel with charm to spare.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel, bit pricey, but worth it. Make plans to stay at The Burnham.”
Reviews.Author: Stephsterlh
Reviews.Content: Off the beaten path, as it's located in the Loop just catty corner from Macys on State Street. The Macys is the old Marshall Fields main store that has the windows at Christmas with the big tree inside. The Burnham rooms are decorated so lovely, very clean. The lobby and restaurant The Applewood are wonderful too. The building was one of the original skyscrapers in Chicago, a converted office building. Top notch, stay there when you are in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at boutique historical hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaibab78
Reviews.Content: Employees were very helpful, great location, clean room, and comfortable beds. Nightly wine (& beer) hour was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: AppleTech
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff. Building is amazing... like stepping back to a century ago. Only downside is the Wifi is kind of lame... Kimpton requires you to sign up into their rewards system before accessing, and performance was not great.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising find with outstanding staff!”
Reviews.Author: LAEDavenport
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay and we chose it because it was pet friendly. We instantly noticed this upon arrival! They offered my dog a treat and the gentleman at the front desk seemed to understand how to approach a dog without being intrusive. :) The hotel did NOT smell like animals and there was no evidence (fur/soiled floors) of animal guests with the exception of one bark in a room near ours! The room was small but entirely charming and perfect for short stays. THe bed was comfortable, the entire hotel was clean and full of character, it's in a phenomenal location (we went to the Christmas market in Daley plaza) with plenty of shopping and restaurant options and it's a short 3 block walk to Grant Park and the attractions near it. The staff were some of the friendliness I've ever encountered. Valet was quick and non-problematic. The restaurant was small and cozy. Be prepared for complimentary hot cocoa with marshmallows upon arrival in the winter, complimentary Starbucks coffee in the morning in the lobby, and a wine hour in the evening. They offer a number of complimentary items if you forget (including a humidifier and heating pad), and others for a nominal fee (between $2-$4). The room had plush robes and sock slippers, a nicely stocked minibar, a mini safe, and great Aveda shampoo/conditioner/lotion/soap products in the bathroom. The only negatives were that there isn't a lot of room in the front for valet parking and the bathroom is small with a small shower and an odd placement of the door! Also, there IS internet but it's not free and there are no special bells and whistles like an iPod docking station or in-room coffee pot. But if you don't "need" those things you would be very comfortable. All in all a great hotel for couples for a great price for a short stay!

Reviews.Title: “In the center of downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: myweekendgetaway
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is an architectural gem. Guest rooms are small but well appointed; bathroom tiny. Outstanding, considerate, helpful staff. Good Sunday brunch in hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “We'll See You Next Year”
Reviews.Author: EricOttawa
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of happy stays in Kimpton hotels in San Francisco and Seattle. The Burnham met the standard - friendly staff, interesting decor, a good restaurant, smallish but comfortable room (with the traditional jungle themed bathrobes) - and in this case, an historic location in the beautifully refurbished Reliance building, one of Chicago's first skyscrapers. The Burnham is a short walk from many cultural spots including the theatre district and the Art Institute. The museum campus is about a 25 walk through Grant Park and along the lakefront. Macy's is across the street. We had inadvertently left some of my wife's sweaters in the room, which were found and shipped to us on our return, thereby reinforcing our satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, but 5 Stars in its category(boutique).”
Reviews.Author: firstinline
Reviews.Content: The location is unbeatable for its proximity not only to the Art Institute , Symphony Hall, theaters, etc. but to the lakefront, the El and other transport. Met friends for a reunion dinner in the Atwood Cafe off the lobby, perfect for such an occasion - like inviting friends to a catered meal at home with excellent service. The building is in top shape, historic and beautiful, with inviting public space and comfy rooms. Only place I'd choose in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Historic building transformed into a charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: For our recent visit to Chicago, we split our stay between our customary Chicago home-away -from-home, the Ritz Carlton, and this hotel. We were anxious to try the Burnham because of the building's history and detailed restoration, and because it is situated in the Loop, the downtown area of Chicago that has so many interesting buildings (our favourites--the Rookery and Mies van der Rohe's two Federal Buildings and Post Office branch), plus some of our favourite haunts--Millennium Park, the Art Institute, Chicago Cultural Center and Chicago Architectural Foundation. The Burnham is housed in the Reliance Building, built in 1895 by Burnham and Root (who also designed the Rookery), and Atwood. The building, one of the first steel-framed skyscrapers in the city, housed retail shopping and professional offices. By the 1940's, the building was in disrepair. The city reclaimed the building in 1994 and began its loving and meticulous restoration; by 1999, it was the Hotel Burnham, a Kimpton hotel. In my opinion, some of the Kimpton brand's style elements can be a bit kitschy, but this has been toned down a bit at the Burnham in deference to its historical elements. It was quite fortuitous that the Chicago Architectural Foundation offered a guided tour of the hotel on the day we checked in--we received our keys literally 5 minutes before the tour began. It became quite clear how historically accurate the restoration project attempted to be--what could not be salvaged and restored was reproduced using old photos and what not. The attention to detail is amazing--the wrought iron work around the elevators (which were originally open cages), the mosaic tile floor by the elevators, the several varieties of marble and the way the veins in each slab are mitered to match adjacent slabs, the preservation and reproduction of a quatrefoil design element (a stylized four leaf clover) in fixtures throughout, the restoration of the original doors and frosted glass windows (now opaqued for privacy) in the guest halls as well as the marble wainscoting and mahogany trim. Even the guest room door knobs have "Reliance" on them, plus the original mail slots and ornamented hinges. Our room, a king, was on the top (15th) floor, so we were able to admire the exterior terra-cotta tiles not only on the sides of the building but on the underside of the roof as well. The room's "Chicago window"--a large central pane with 2 smaller panes on each side, allowed in plenty of light. Looking down Washington St., we could catch a glimpse of Frank Gehry's Pritzker Pavilion in Millennium Park, with the Lake beyond. The room was not large, but comfy. The robes were leopard or tiger print. If you join Kimpton's In Touch Program, you get free Wifi, plus $10 credit from the minibar. There is some noise from the CTA trains. There is what seems to be an original marble staircase with wrought iron railings from floors 7-15. If you are interested in the hotel's more historic elements, I would recommend a room on floors 8 and above, which seem to have more of the original fixtures intact. The hotel has a small fitness room. The "business center" is a computer and printer in the hall in the basement (per minute fees). There is coffee and tea in the morning in the lobby, and a wine reception nightly. The Atwood Cafe is open for all meals and seems most popular at lunch. We tried it for dinner one night and were not terribly impressed by the food, although the space itself and decor are charming. If you are a Rick Bayless fan, he has a tortas place in Macy's across the street, in its fancy food court on the 7th floor. Hotel staff was uniformly friendly and outgoing. All in all a very nice stay. History, location, charm, service, comfort--a winning combination.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chatto
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a number of Chicago hotels, including all of the Klimptons, and while I think that the Klimpton chains are by far the best in the business, this hotel's location helps to put it at the top of my list. It is across the street from Macy's, a few blocks from the museum, down the street from the Chicago Cultural Center and the park, and surrounded by great restaurants and public transport. The staff are friendly, helpful, and efficient, the rooms are awesome and provide great views of the city (wonderful people watching on the lower floors). I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. PS -- the bar has great ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate!”
Reviews.Author: teamthomas98
Reviews.Content: This is a 122 room hotel that made my husband and me feel like we were their only guests. It is amazing to stay in the historic and architecturally significant building. It is convenient to several Chicago attractions. Our every question and need was attended to by cheerful staff. The room (especially the mattress and bed coverings) was comfortable. Absolutely a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Pigeonherder
Reviews.Content: Who would have thought you could have such a comfortable hotel right downtown Chicago that was so quiet. The staff is friendly, and very accommodating. Plus you're steps away from all of Chicago's greatest spots and staying in an important historic landmark. The decor in the rooms is a little too frou-frou for my tastes, but not overly obnoxious.

Reviews.Title: “Very enchanting. Just what it looks like!”
Reviews.Author: betsyscott
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends for a birthday gathering from out of town earlier this year. LOVE IT HERE! It's majestic and beautiful right in the heart of the city. Every picture you see really is just like the hotel - unlike a few other Chicago hotels. And the best part is that it REALLY is a boutique hotel! Charming but not cheap and family-like in service! I feel like many hotels overuse the term "boutique" and this hotel really warrants it. Five stars - highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Historic, friendly, convenient, only warning is train noise is hard to avoid in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: K12345
Reviews.Content: It was a treat to stay in a hotel that is historic with friendly service and many extras. As is true for any hotel in the area, the elevated train noise can be disturbing so bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “I want to live here!”
Reviews.Author: Laura J
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff and the bellman were incredibly helpful and friendly. They were full of recommendations for things to see and do while in town! I left my super-pricey D&G sunglasses in my room after I checked out, and housekeeping caught me on my way out to return them to me. I really felt like the staff were excellent at this hotel. Never have I met such friendly and welcoming people working at a hotel! The only downsides were (a) that the room was beginning to appear a little worn down and (b) the road noise. (a) There was a tiny amount of wallpaper peeling from the wall, and there was a mark on the wall in the bathroom. (b) I could hear the traffic down on the street while I was trying to sleep, but that's my fault for picking a second-floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: Marlene S
Reviews.Content: Most plan the destination first, and find the hotel later, but the Burnham is the reason to visit Chicago. Every staff member from front desk to housekeeping remember their customers' names and treat them as if they are royalty. A special shout out to Lisa, Darnell, and Keith, but those are only the names I remember. Dining is fabulous and every effort is made to accommodate special needs.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: StopKickingMySeat
Reviews.Content: Great location right on the blue/red lines and buses for farther out restaurants and airports, but close to a lot of 'first visit' things to do. Friendly and informative staff, they try very hard, and succeed, at making sure you know where you're going. The only dissapointment I have is that the quality of the TV in the rooms is horrible. Would have thought for the price that they would have HD (and a few more basic cable channels wouldn't hurt). Granted, Chicago has plenty to keep you busy, but if you're pooped after a day of walking and sight seeing and you want to just relax for a night in your room, it would be nice to have the 37" flat screen actually be clear enough to enjoy. Other than that, had a great stay and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great with a couple of minor flaws.”
Reviews.Author: peewee007
Reviews.Content: Great reception, valet parking, nice historic building, pretty restaurant, nice reasonable room, internet worked instantly ... everything was going well until I went to take a shower. I pulled back the shower curtain and at first I thought there was a small rodent hanging out by the drain; it turned out to be a less threatening large wad of hair. Still, everything else looked spotless so this didn't cast a pall over the mostly lovely experience. Lunch in the restaurant in the lobby was tasty, and the setting was lovely. On Saturday morning the lobby was full, literally full, of tour groups learning about the building in a variety of languages. (We stayed in our room through lunch one day and got a note slid under our door telling us that we'd missed maid service; then they came anyway and cleaned the room, so not much of a story there.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very elegant”
Reviews.Author: TXnonnie
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Sniqueaway, and it was a winner. The location (Washington and State) is just a block or two away from every subway/El line and literally across the street from about 8 bus lines. The hotel is in a historic building and the rooms are beautifully decorated. The staff greeted us every time we walked in the door, which I think is a Kimpton trademark. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Marc R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Burnham in August 2011 for a birthday weekend. We loved it! The staff was excellent. We found them very friendly, personable, helpful, and all around committed to making guests feel welcomed and happy. Martin was the real standout. He went above and beyond in every way, especially in the extra touches he arranged for the birthday. Praise also goes out to Liz, Emil, Vani, Kelly, and Daniel. They were all friendly and helpful. Our room, on the second floor, was lovely. The appointments were luxurious. We enjoyed the Aveda products in the bathroom, the well-priced gourmet snacks in the mini-bar, the comfortable desk, the chaise lounge, and the lovely curtains, linens, and upholstery. Our only complaint is that the bed was a little too firm and we were woken up one night by a parking garage alarm on the other side of Washington Street. We are reasonable and understand that the bed is under the Burnhamâ€™s control, the parking garage is not. We got used to the bed, but the first night was a bit restless. The historic features and fixtures are enjoyable and make for a unique experience, but the attention to detail in the here and now are what really makes the Burnham a standout. Easily reachable from the airports by rail, the Burnham is centrally located to all the best in downtown Chicago. It was a five minute walk to Millennium Park, another ten minutes through the park to the Art Institute, a ten minute bus ride from the Burnham to the Shay Aquarium and Adler Planetarium, a fifteen minute walk to the river and a fifteen minute walk to the lakeshore. We had to take a taxi at night to and from Navy Pier, but the flagship Marshall Field (now Macyâ€™s) was caddy corner on Washington and State Streets. The Burnham has a restaurant named the Atwood CafÃ©. We dined there one evening for dessert and one morning for breakfast. The food was good and so was the service and setting. As this was our first Kimpton experience, there were unexpected surprises like the morning Starbucks (including decaf), the house dogs and fish (Albert), and the evening wine hour. We definitely recommend the Burnham and look forward to staying there the next time weâ€™re in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tkchic
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at The Hotel Burnham and would stay again in a heart beat! The location was perfect as we were attending the Chicago Gourmet in Millenium Park. Fabulous food for breakfast. The rooms may be small for some, but it is just what we needed for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl G
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th stay at Hotel Burnham and we will stay there again when in Chicago. The staff is always gracious and knowledgeable. Whether one is wanting and needing directions, the name of a good place to eat or sight seeing suggestions. The location is the best to be able to walk and enjoy many places downtown even the area including Navy Pier and Miracle Mile. The hotel has a great history and they left the architeture intact.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small historic hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: susantravels20
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel with history, helpful staff, and well located for sightseeing. Rooms are on small side but you really know you are part of Chicago and it's architecture staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Gnomenatty
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this lovely hotel and loved it. The hotel is well located in the centre of Chicago right on the shopping streets. We walked everywhere and didn't miss having a car. Our room was big with a huge bed (although apparently we only had a standard room). Beautiful clean bathroom which was kept immaculate during our stay by housekeeping. Loved the touch of the zebra or leopard print dressing gowns!! We had a room overlooking the street but we were high enough not to be kept awake by the road noise. The staff were excellent - friendly and helpful but all very efficient. We did not eat in the restaurant but it did look nice but we had no food included in our room price. One piece of advice - join as a Kimpton In Touch member and you get free Wifi and $10 to spend on the mini bar. Excellent touches like free coffee to take away in the morning and free wine reception in the evening for all guests.

Reviews.Title: “perfect weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: marily21
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an overnight at the Burnham. Picked this hotel based on location, Tripadvisor reviews, and on price. We were in Chicago for the Badger game at Soldier Field. Took Amtrak from Milwaukee to Chicago, and it was an easy walk from Union Station to the hotel. What we were not prepared for, was the history and beauty of this hotel, and the overall helpful attitude of the staff. From the front desk, to the luggage attendants, to the doormen, everyone we encountered was friendly and clearly aimed to please. The hotel is located nearby to lots of restaurants and shopping. We recommend Miller's pub for lunch or dinner, another place filled with lots of history, and good food, also a short walk away from the hotel (on Wasbash). We ordered out Pizano's pizza for supper, and they delivered in about an hour, worth the wait. We wish we had had one more day, but enjoyed our visit immensely, and would definitely return to the Burnham. Our room on the fourth floor was not huge, but adequate, and the views of State and Washington were wonderful. There is a Walgreen's almost adjacent, and a Navy Pier across the street. We did not have a car, but everything was either easy to walk to, or easy to use public transportation to get to. Also loved that this hotel is a smaller boutique hotel, and with the history attached, the architecture and interior public/lobby areas are simply beautful. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Historical little hotel in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: mwmGrandRapidsMi
Reviews.Content: The Burnham is a boutique hotel, but in a historical building built by the famous architect John Burnham. The rooms are small but well appointed. The staff is great.. Very friendly and helpful, right down to the doorman and valet parking people. The restaurant in the hotel is beautifully appointed with fantastic food.

Reviews.Title: “An Elegant Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alan K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent six nights at this wonderful, small hotel (122 rooms) which is located in the heart of downtown Chicago. We prefer small hotels so that you get to know the people at the desk who, in this case, were extremely knowledgeable and helpful about directions and activities in the area. We did not need a car since everything we wanted to do was available by walking or using the CTA. The atmosphere was one of the old, traditional hotels. The choice of daily newspapers and coffee in the lobby were nice touches. The Atwood Cafe on the first floor served a wonderful breakfast and weekend brunch. We used a SniqueAway reservation so the value was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: npr_ire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and 1 1/2 year old son. Very nice room on 10th floor. Staff were very nice on arrival and very helpful when we asked for anything. Good location and easy to get to on the train from the airport (2 min walk to the subway stop which goes direct to O'Hare). Short walk to Millenium park. Staff in the restaurant were excellent too. Would recommend to anyone staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location”
Reviews.Author: Peregrin8or
Reviews.Content: We booked a room through one of the Internet aggregators and scored a great price given that it was for the 4th of July. We were gratified that the lobby, rooms and everything about the place lived up to the online reviews and the hotel's own web site. The location inside the loop is excellent for either walking or grabbing the "L" to more remote locations (including the airport). Also, the staff were incredibly helpful and courteous. I only wish that we had tried their restaurant, but that will have to wait for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Lobby!!!”
Reviews.Author: JBalzli
Reviews.Content: The lobby and common spaces in this hotel share a beautiful historic charm characteristic of the the epic "Chicago School" style of architecture. The rooms (at least my room) don't quite share same aesthetic at all. The room was quite nice but was uncomfortably mismatched with the historic character of the building. Instead it seemed to be stuck in the early 90's which, I believe, is when the hotel was renovated. Nevertheless, this place is in a great location; the rooms are comfortable if a tad small; and I loved their breakfast tea selection even if the remainder of the complimentary breakfast was a bit sparse. Unfortunately, the animal print robes were tattered and tacky - not at all fitting for a hotel in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Verrrry nice, comfortable, well-run”
Reviews.Author: EastBayTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on business. Friendly staff, from doorman to checkin to housekeeping. Warm, upscale, charming lobby. Interesting room doors (like office doors from the 30s, but the glass is completely opaque). Fair-sized rooms, larger than Hotel Monaco, but small, though adequate, bathroom. Comfortable bed, sheets, towels. Slight rattle to a/c. Nice TV, audio, phone, desk area/power. Restaurant in lobby is fun, good but a little limited menu, and slow service at breakfast. Convenient location (one block from state courthouse and maybe 2-3 blocks from federal courthouse). Easy access to Blue Line, one block away. I usually stay at Sofitel in Chicago, but the Burnham is now tied for first place in Chicago in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Dog/pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: MissMissouri_11
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few hotels in Chicago that allow animals. We have a 45 pound lab mix we were bring with us on vacation. The Grant Park is the closest park and its about 5-6 blocks away from the hotel. It was a pretty far walk to take our dog out. The room was very nice the view was great, the bed was a little stiff and the shower drained slow those are the only complaints. The valet guys were nice & the staff was very friendly. They greeted us every time we came in. The hotel is very quiet didn't hear any noise at night which was great. The history on the hotel was awesome to read. Great price for a hotel right in downtown Chicago. It was close to most things, we walked to the skydeck, michigan ave ect. We took a taxi to Navy Pier and it ran about $12 not including tip. The old navy is right across the street from the hotel also the disney store, dunkin donuts, subway ect. Will be staying here next time we come to visit. Very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “This will be our home for future Chicago visits.”
Reviews.Author: OsoBear
Reviews.Content: From the initial greeting at the door to final checkout, the staff could not have been more attentive. The location is very near the Art Museum, the reason for our visit. The room was spotless and quiet at night. Could not find fault with this property.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, will returrn!”
Reviews.Author: travelmore300
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel based upon location and proximety to where my daughter was staying in Chicago. I couldn't be more pleased. The rooms (stayed twice in one month! were very quiet, comfortable and well furnished. The views are amazing and it is located just two blocks from Millennium and Grant Park. The restaurant has fanastic service and good food, the prices are reasonable also. The hotel is in a refurbished building with great details. I can't wait to come back and stay here again! I joined the Kimpton Loyalty program (free) and I was upgraded to a upper floor in the hotel, and received other benefits.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: travelrevi
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel with great service in a good location. The rooms are small but not intolerable. The hotel is clean and the beds are comfortable. The bathrooms are small and lack some modern must haves such as a curved shower curtain rod. The restaurant on site is good and fairly priced. I would stay here again based on the price. Anything over $175 is too expensive for this hotel. It is purely a value stay for a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: SeanHickey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived on a Sunday morning at 9:00 am on Aug 21st. We did not expect any rooms to be available since most of Chicago was booked for the weekend. We checked out bags in a holding room til the afternoon. We eventually made it back to the hotel around 3:00. The check in was lightning quick. We stayed in the historic section on 12 th floor in room 1205. We had great view of State and Washington and everywhere else. We had a deluxe queen comfortable bed , nice couch, desk, closet, mini bar, and flat screen. The showers had the best water pressure that I can ever remember. Aveda bath products if you're imto that sort of thing. I'm used to Hampton inn generic myself. The Burnham had a restaurant near the lobby that I wish we would have visited instead of Quartino Italian up the road. The folks working the front desk were friendly and very helpful. The location was good, right next to the blue and red line stations. If i return to Chicago, I will most certainly reserve a room here again. I recommend the Hotel Burnham, an Incubus concert at Northerly pavillion, and Bobby's bike tours.

Reviews.Title: “A lot to love at the Burnham”
Reviews.Author: CindySanti10
Reviews.Content: On my recent weeklong stay in Chicago, I discovered there is much to love at the Hotel Burnham. There are also a few areas in need of minor improvement â€“ from my perspective as both interior designer and traveler. I must say the location and the building itself are terrific! The hotel occupies a renovated office building built in 1895 and many beautiful architectural features remain. We stayed in suite 804 â€“ below is the roomâ€™s old office door and the charming 8th floor elevator lobby. The common areas on the first floor are equally beautiful. The small lobby hosts a wine reception each evening, a Kimpton trademark. I adore the orange chairs! Note the contrast welt and cutout back on the lobby sofa. Details make a difference! The largest rooms/suites at the Burnham feature a bedroom and living space, separated by French doors. Unfortunately, the French doors only have sheer curtains, so anyone trying to sleep in the bedroom is subjected to light from the living area. The king bed is very comfortable. There is a canopy of sorts over the bed, which doesnâ€™t appear to have any relationship to the room, although it does camouflage the smoke detector and sprinkler head. The ceilings are quite high, adding volume to a small floor space (the French doors scrape along the side of the bed as you try to close them). The left corner quarter-round side table is stylishly delightful, but the lamps in both rooms appear under-scale. The seating area features a fabulous mirror and a tiny settee. Sadly, the settee is uncomfortable for one person, and impossible for two! The only other seat in the room is the desk chair. Also, that little settee does not turn into a pull-out, which seems a lost opportunity for flexibility, especially for a hotel as friendly to children as the Burnham. The bathroom is very small but well appointed. Aveda toiletries elevate the experience. Of course, the trademark Kimpton animal print robes are at hand.Suite 804 had windows on two sides, both with excellent downtown views. The hotel is easy walking distance to many Chicago attractions, including Millenium Park, the Cloud Gate (jellybean) and the Jay Pritzger Pavilion, seen in the background below. Service at the hotel is generally quite good and always friendly. The restaurant, Atwood Cafe, serves a wonderful breakfast. Service here was outstanding in the morning. In the evening, we did have dinner here once, and service was not as good. Also, the menu is fairly eclectic, making it tricking to feed a picky young diner. There are better nearby options for dinner if you are traveling with young children, but adults would thoroughly enjoy the fare. Any place that serves up Red Velvet Cookie Dough for dessert is worth a try in my book! One personal difficulty at the Atwood: the banquette seating at the tables closest to the windows. It's hard to see in the picture below, but the banquettes look terrific with an asymmetrical back. Unfortunately, the lower side of that back provides zero support for diners and hit my back at a painfully low height. Just a word of caution for anyone above average height. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Burnham. However, after a week, the room issues I mentioned were looming large for our party of three. I do recommend the hotel, but would myself opt for a larger space in another hotel next time. The Burnham's rooms are ideally suited to a maximum of two travelers. All my pictures are located on my blog at: http://exuberanthome.com/travel-tuesday-â€“-hotel-burnham-in-chicago

Reviews.Title: “The Only Hotel I Visit in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bewler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Burnham is charming, well appointed and has simply some of the warmest and friendliest staff I have met in any hotel. They are welcoming without being cloying and make each guest feel like the most important people at the hotel. The rooms are small by newer hotel standards but come fully appointed with internet, tv and lovely decor. If spacious modern hotels are your preference, this probably isn't the hotel for you. But if you can appreciate the beauty of a lovingly restored Chicago landmark and value service above all else, this will be a perfect fit. Among the many ways the staff went above and beyond: my husband & I visited for our anniversary and had reservations to dine in the hotel's Atwood Cafe (which is very good). My husband can't drink alcohol so I went down to the bar in the morning to ask if they served non-alcoholic beer so we could toast each other at dinner. It turns out they did not have any. I asked if I could bring my own and gentleman behind the bar said they would procure some for us by supper time. About an hour later I asked to speak to the manager so I could tell him how impressed I was by the staff's willingness to get the NA beer for our dinner that evening and he said "Oh ma'am, we already picked it up - it's chilling in the refrigerator and will be ready when you dine with us". Now how's THAT for service? It used to be that when I traveled to Chicago I found the cheapest rates on Expedia and stayed wherever it sent me. That's how I found the Hotel Burnham. However, after having stayed there the first time, it is now the ONLY hotel my husband & I stay in when we visit Chicago even though we can find better rates elsewhere. We have now stayed there several times and the service has never disappointed and the rooms are always clean, airy, and neat. The hotel is also conveniently located a few blocks from the Art Institute , the opera house, Millenium Park and a manageable walk to the Miracle Mile as well as other local attractions. I really cannot recommend this hotel highly enough to those with a love of something charming and a little different from the generic offerings of chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Two Words: Wine Hour.”
Reviews.Author: GyrlGeek
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip for 3 days and I cannot praise this hotel enough. This ranks as one of my top 3 hotel stays ever in any city ever. The staff was friendly and accommodating. But the building...that is the star of the show. It has been beautifully maintained and really is breathtaking. The location is excellent and right in the middle the loop. As if that wasn't enough, there is a wine hour every night. My first day was a VERY long training and the concierge met me in the lobby with a glass of white sangria (delish). There was a glass of wine in the lobby waiting for me every day during my stay which really made coming back to the room a pleasure. From the wrought iron covered elevators, to the marble stairs and even the small touches like the traditional keys and plush robes in the room this hotel is definitely worth checking out. I just hate that I didn't take pictures!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Gigi459
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days at this boutique hotel. Excellent location. All public transportation was right outside the door. Only 2 blocks from Mellenium Park (great free concerts) bring your own wine and cheese! Walking distance to Magnificent Mile. Hop on the red line to Wrigley's field. Cab ride from Midway airport was about $30. If you are traveling about the city buy the CTA 7 day pass for public transportation. Architectural tour was great also. Staff at the hotel were friendly and welcoming. Not your cookie cutter hotel, the ambiance and decor was a refreshing break. Lobby was small, loved the free wine hour every day. Coffee or cool drinks available thoughout the day. Continental breakfast was actually a sit-down at their lovely restaurant. Fruit, juice, bagel/toast and coffee served by a very friendly staff. If you forget tolietries or any clothing, hotel is right next to a Walgreens, and many stores. We celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary and they sent us some complimentary champagne. Staff also left us notes hoping we were enjoying our stay. Would highly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied in this super-short stay”
Reviews.Author: sockrebel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for literally 6 hours (mostly sleeping), but I was happily satisfied. I arrived really late as my flight landed into ORD at 11:30pm. The lady at the front desk was really warm and receptive. As an Inner Circle Member, I was upgraded to an Executive King Suite. For saying the secret code word of the month, she also gave me a $25(?) dining credit, which I didn't use because I didn't have time, but the gesture was appreciated. I got an actual key to my room (vs a card - can't remember the last time that happened). Kinda went with the whole feel of the place. One of the smaller suites I stayed in (it's a smaller-type hotel), but I had a corner room, and the view was fabulous at night! The room was clean and the bed was comfy enough, but I was exhausted, so I can't accurately judge good or bad (nor could I pay attention to much else). I had to get up early to check out a little after 6am to get to a meeting. I wanted to print some stuff out for it, and the staff directed me to a computer tucked away. However, it required a credit card and authorization and just seemed like too much of a hassle just to print a couple sheets so I went on my way. Like I said, super-short stay. Wish I got to experience the Burnham for longer.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation Yet”
Reviews.Author: DallasFmlyman
Reviews.Content: While on vacation in the Chicago area we stayed here at the hotel Burnham; and it was amazing. This has to be the best location in Chicago not to mention some of the most if not the most amazing staff that I have met in a hotel. From the time that we arrived to the hotel until the time that we checked out it was great service not only from the hotel staff; but the restaurant staff as well. They truely went out of their way to make this one of the most memorible family vacations thus far; and that is hard to do with two teenage girls....Lol Thanks for everything and should we visit Chicago again, the hotel Burnham will without a doubt be our choice hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Adorable Boutique Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: CityGirl610
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure I was going to love the Burnham - I'm a huge fan of Kimpton, but knew this was an older hotel. I could not have been more wrong! I spent just one night with my mom and it was fabulous. The hotel is small-ish and has an art-deco feel. The staff, from valet to front desk were absolutely wonderful. The service is fantastic and sincere, without being obtrusive. When you check in, you get regular old keys, which was kind of neat and added to the antique feel of the property. Our room - which had two double beds - was much larger than I expected. The ceilings were quite high, which I think added to the spacious feeling. I loved the decor -- especially the navy blue drapes with gold writing. Beds were very, very comfortable and bathroom was spacious with nice Aveda amenities. The real stand-out at the Burnham is the Atwood Cafe, their onsite restaurant. We had the three course meal for $40.00, which was a fantastic price. The food was simple (we had vegetable soup, cod and a chocolote peanut butter cake for dessert), but so so good. Also, the portions were perfect. Not too big (which I can't stand), so you could really enjoy each course. Service was out of this world. Again, helpful but not too much. The next time I'm in Chicago, I'll definitely be returning to this hotel. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ttrinter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend and fell in love with this historic, boutique hotel. The room we had was on a corner, with beautiful views of the city. The hotel had a social hour in the lobby with wine, which was a very nice touch. The restaurant served a very good Sunday brunch. I hope to be able to spend another weekend here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel......can't wait to re-visit!”
Reviews.Author: Janlshop
Reviews.Content: Room was great, employees were helpful and friendly. I was celebrating my birthday, and they left me a nice note and bottle of wine in my room!!! We had booked a special and we got free breakfast which we ate at the outside cafe and it was fabulous!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific non-chain-like Kimpton in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: louisianamom
Reviews.Content: Traveling two or three times a month on business, I love hotels that don't look like hotels - and the Burnham is a typical Kimpton property in that regard. Conveniently located (although not in the heart of Michigan Ave hotel/shopping - closer to Grant Park) and decorated like the turn of the century building it clearly once was. Real doorknobs and keys, doors with frosted glass and early 20th century decor make this a wonderful change of pace hotel. Had a terrific meal in the hip downstairs restaurant and the staff was terrific - had me upgraded to a suite after a very late arrival from ORD. Would stay here as a leisure traveler - and that is the highest praise I can give a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: mobox
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Burnham while I was in Chicago for a conference. It's a small, boutique hotel owned by the great chain Kimpton. All the Kimpton hotels I've stayed at have been lovely and the Burnham is no exception. Rooms are decent sized for such a small hotel. I happened to get the handicap accessible room so my bathroom was oversized (NICE!). Good water pressure and and nice toiletries. Big flat screen TV and a mini-bar. Towels and linens were good quality and the bed was very comfortable. My room faced the street and you could definitely hear the city sounds so if you don't like honking and such, ask for an interior room. But interior rooms have no view and I was able to watch the city speed by, which I like. There is a restaurant attached and while I didn't eat there, I did get a glass of wine both nights. The menu looks very nice. There is also a nice manager's happy hour in the evening if you would like a glass of wine. I would recommend the Burnham highly. It was in close proximity and walking distance of the river, Miracle Mile, and Millenium Park and museums. A great location!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - will be back!”
Reviews.Author: pwinn_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and clean. Excellent location to shopping/restaurants/Park/theatre - all within walking distance. Lots of freebies: Starbucks coffee and tea in the lobby beginning at 6:00 AM. Wine served at 5:00. Always fresh water in the lobby. Staff is very friendly and accomodating. Room deco is great, bed comfy and normal size bathroom! I was very pleased with the stay and will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: edandmer
Reviews.Content: From the second we checked in, we were thoroughly impressed and happy. This is a beautiful hotel in a gorgeous building. Emil took very good care of us and had milk and cookies sent up. All in all, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room and service. So close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: quadcity007
Reviews.Content: This was our first time visiting Chicago and we wanted to cover a lot. The hotel is two blocks from Millenium Park, 3 blocks from the Magnificant Mike and 2 blocks from the Riverwalk. The subway stop is 1 block away. Short cab rides to Old Town. Extremely clean and staff was very informative. If we stayed elsewhere we likely would not have had as good of a time. The rooms are perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sove4547
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Burnham Hotel in Chicago. The staff is very friendly, helpful and we received excellent service. We were upgraded to a corner suite with an amazing view of the city. The rooms were clean and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is very charming, located in the middle of town (the loop) , within walking distance to the Millennium park and other attractions in the area. For sure will recommend to my friends when they visit Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Service is slipping...no longer my favorite Kimpton and not my choice for a Chicago stay”
Reviews.Author: jlmcc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Burnham a few years ago and while originally I was happy to be back, I think the service is slipping--or certainly was not great when I was there. I booked a room at The Burnham as the Palomar (in which I have stayed in twice this spring) was full. The location is still good for tourists. The hotel is located in the Loop area blocks from Millennium Park and the Geary stage, near the Art Institute, and close to all the major museums and aquarium. Nordstrom Rack next door, and Starbucks a few doors down. The hotel is a great historic building and so the room sizes vary. I paid and signed up for a Kimpton upgrade online. I was told it was granted (via email) but surprisingly when I checked in at 6:30 pm, the room I was given was smaller than the rooms I typically have occupied at this hotel. It was the smallest double I have ever seen!! It certainly was NOT an upgrade and when I mentioned it to the front desk that it was a low floor, no view, and really tiny, they said it was all they had. I found out later that it wasn't the case and another employee admitted it wasn't an upgrade and the hotel wasn't full. I don't know if I was given such a dinky room since I checked in so late in the day, but I had business meetings since my arrival on a 8:30 am flight that morning and didn't have time to come to the hotel earlier. I had to remind the staff that I was a Kimpton In Touch member and ask for the coupon that usually is handed to a member on arrival. They tried to tell me I wasn't an In Touch member (which I found funny since I had stayed in a Kimpton hotel twice in May--Chicago and DC) but they finally located the envelope addressed to me with the coupon. They didn't apologize. I spent the evening outside the hotel at a private party and then dinner--at RL which is one of my all time favorites. When we returned, I wanted to go have drinks with my sister and found out that the hotel restaurant and bar closes at 10 pm. Since it wasn't busy, apparently they were closing at 9:45 pm instead--it seemed rather early for a Friday night.--and couldn't give us a glass of wine to take to our rooms. So I asked the front desk for a recommendation but they said they didn't know anything in the area that was open. So I asked about room service--thinking we would order a bottle of wine. The person at the desk said his colleague (who was standing next to him) handles room service and referred me to him. Problem was that the colleague was on a personal phone call right at the desk! I literally waited over 4 minutes listening to him talk to his friends loudly and finally just gave up and went upstairs. I was only there 1 night (flew in for business, checked in at 6:30 pm, immediately left the hotel for dinner and returned at 9:30 pm and then checked out the next morning and went to O'Hare) so it didn't really matter but I will not be staying at this Kimpton in Chicago again. I admit I am disappointed as I used to love this hotel and raved about it to friends, but the service seems to have fallen. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is adequate but merely average. I stay in Kimpton hotels around the country and their standard is so high, that the average stands out as below the bar. Next time I will be staying at the Chicago Palomar whose service is up to the usual fantastic Kimpton standard.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding all around!”
Reviews.Author: allthegoodonesaregon
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is an amazing piece of history and wonderfully renovated while still maintaining the original charm. The staff couldn't be friendlier and the location is outstanding. The warmth and professionalism of everyone there was superb, I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: loblolly9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite, it was perfect for 2 nights. Yes, the bathroom is small, but for us it added to the charm of the Burnham. The staff is the best, along with the sangria and wine late afternoon happy hour. We also had lunch in the Atwood Cafe, which was satisfying. As other reviewers have mentioned, for the price, location, and customer service, it's hard to go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Burnham lived up to it's reviews”
Reviews.Author: thebunter
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. Chose it because of previous reviews on Tripadvisor. On arrival we were greeted by "George" who happily assisted us into the check-in and processed our valet parking. "Emil" on the desk could not have been more pleasant and assisted us with a rapid check-in and advice on where to eat. The rooms are not spacious but exceptionally clean and surprisingly very quiet given the hotel is located on a busy street. A plus for us was that the air-conditioning was quiet which is often a real problem in hotel rooms. The location is perfect and definitely in walking distance for most things...eg" Magnificent Mile" and view of the river. Chicago is a wonderful city and we can't wait to return and will most certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Thefishy4
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went up to spend some time with her family in downtown Chicago. The location of this hotel was excellent. The staff were 100% wonderful. There was never a time in 4 days that they weren't friendly, nice and accommodating. When I travel to Chicago again, I will stay only in this hotel! We had a room on the 15th floor and the view was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - very good and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: rrichjj
Reviews.Content: I stayed for almost two weeks at the Burnham in June. Was there mostly for work and a bit of pleasure. The staff at the hotel were excellent. Very friendly and accommodating to whatever I needed - or just saying hello when I returned at the end of the day. The room was very nice as well - a good size for the price and all the amenities that I needed. A good desk and chair were especially welcome considering I often worked in the room. The location is excellent for both work and for exploring Chicago. Walking distance to most attractions and very near to two different "L" stops means you can access everything in Chicago very easily. The little extras were nice as well - coffee in the morning in the lobby, drinks in the evening both very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best service EVER”
Reviews.Author: Flakenbake
Reviews.Content: For our first anniversy my husband and I stayed at the hotel Burnham and could not have asked for better service. We were there two nights and by the end of the first day the staff knew our names and what we had done that day, it was great. They even sent up a bottle of wine for us to celebrate with. The location was about 2 blocks east of millienum park and right in the heart of shopping. It was an easy walk to the L, although we never used it. We were able to easily walk to the art muesum, and Navy pier. Also, very close to the theather district. The rooms were small, but we were in a large city so I kind of expected that. The did well decorating in that space. My husband did not like the bed, which is why I gave comfort of the room a 3. Overall the staff was very helpful, the room was beautiful and the area was GREAT. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Little Gem Of A Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beeknee4lk9
Reviews.Content: Don't overlook this little gem of a hotel. This place is in a great location with Millenium Park just down the street and Macys across the street. Our friends stayed at the Palmer House and wished they had heard about this place as the service there was terrible. Complimentary Starbucks coffee in the morning, wine between 5:00 and 6:00pm and large pitchers of lemon and berry water available free throughout the day...little touch but welcome after hours outside exploring this great city. Hotel is also very pet friendly. The staff was VERY accommodating in every way and we never felt that any request was a bother...especially helpful doormen. The rooms are small but well designed, clean and have everything you would need; Nice Aveda toiletries, good sized flat screen, free internet access, mini bar, pillow menu and bathrobes are all included.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: hotelfan
Reviews.Content: My family of four spent my birthday in The Burnham in mid june. It was great. Martin, the front desk manager is a charming man who was kind enough to get my wife and me a corner room which allowed us to look up Washington to see the top of the Gehry pavilion in Millenium Park and down the truly great street, State Street, to see the Chicago theatre. We were directly kitty corner across the street from what was the flagship Marshall Field's store, sadly, now Macy's. It was a short 2 block walk to visit Millenium park and an easy walk a few more blocks to the Art Institute. Or, we could have turned left and walked the magnificent mile. The room was lovely and met all of our needs. We had breakfast in the bustling ground floor restaurant and it too was excellent. They also set out coffee for those who just want to grab a free cup of joe on your way out the door. Kimpton properties are uniformly well run and exude a "fun" vibe. This may be their very best property. The physical plant and the staff are excellent. My kids room was small, only 175 square feet but they use every inch and it did not feel crowded. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You'll smile when you walk in”
Reviews.Author: Shain
Reviews.Content: You walk into this place and you think you've been transported back to the turn of the century; you expect Theodore Dreiser or Ginevra King, the Chicago debutante first love of F. Scott Fitzgerald, to be standing in the absolutely magnificent Beaux-Arts lobby. It's no wonder that the restoration of the interior of this building won so many architectural awards. Returning to the 21st century, the clerks at the front desk are very helpful but not fawning.
