I give the hotel four stars instead of five only because I would have liked a comfortable sitting chair and a coffee maker in the room. The king room at least is too small to fit the extra furniture, although it's very well-appointed for its size and there is a work desk with enough light. As mentioned by other reviewers, the location couldn't be more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the exact centre of the city”
Reviews.Author: Clerkenwell76
Reviews.Content: Very difficult to fault this place. We stayed two nights, having booked a queen room and then been offered an upgrade to a queen suite for a discounted rate. Rooms : - Atmospheric lifts and stairways, old fashioned doors - Views were an absolute knockout - we were on the 9th floor and because of the bay windows had views both ways, North up State towards the famous "Chicago" sign and East down Washington to the park and yes you can see the lake at the end - Suite was well furnished with a good bed and sofa area. Good bathroom (with bath, nice robes). Wifi is a bit of a faff as to get it free you have to sign up for a loyalty programme Reception, breakfast, location : - Impressive public areas, friendly and helpful staff - helped with ipad charging, umbrellas - We had a deal with a free continental breakfast. This was a bagel with butter, jam, a large fruit salad and tea / coffee, orange juice. More filling than it sounds. Service was great. - Location could not be better. Everything in the loop is within an easy walk. El/subway stations on all lines are within 2 minutes' walk for travel further afield.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small but nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: KMKC08
Reviews.Content: As a last minute option, this hotel offered a classic feel and is in a convenient location. The rooms are small, but clean and well decorated. The restaurant is very good and has a nice seating area outside. Try the short ribs. I found the price to be acceptable as I booked this at the last minute. However, I do not think it's worth more than $250 a night simply because the rooms are tiny and there are so many other options in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quiet and interesting architecture.”
Reviews.Author: gmce02
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again,the location is ideal for tourism, shopping and/or business. The hotel is relatively small by US standards, with only a few rooms on each floor. A nice change from the generic larger hotel chains that abound in Chicago. Pet friendly (though I did not bring a dog) and relaxed atmosphere. The room was quite small but very comfortable and most importantly extremely quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service that made our anniversary special”
Reviews.Author: mousehouse75
Reviews.Content: I stayed here (via hotwire) for our 3rd anniversary. The front desk staff was incredible, helping to arrange a beautiful bouquet waiting for us in our room (and threw in complimentary champagne and wine). Great attitudes throughout. The hotel itself is beautiful, much character but cleanly renovated. The rooms are small, however, and bathroom fixtures not that luxurious (but fine).

Reviews.Title: “Now I can't stay anywhere else in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: yesimallpacked
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late, sorry. But judging by all the other positive reviews here, it's ok. This was my son and my 2nd time in Chicago (come for the museums, architecture and culture). It was also our 2nd time staying here. Don't pass up the chance to stay here. Very unique buildling. Look up the history of the building. Friendly, helpful staff. Restaurant right there if you want it. Central location. Complimentary tea and coffee all morning in the lobby. Why stay on the Magnificent Mile in a hotel that you won't remember, when you can stay here?

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at Pet Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mahalo2005
Reviews.Content: Our room was comfortable and nicely decorated as you would expect from this kind of hotel. The quality of the food and service at both breakfast and dinner was top notch. The hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and made both us and our small dog feel like members of the family. The location (within a few blocks of the part and waterfront) was very convenient for walking our dog.

Reviews.Title: “Simple elegance done right!”
Reviews.Author: Heidini
Reviews.Content: We felt relaxed from the moment we walked through the doors of this elegant art deco historic hotel. Rich jewel tones, marble and mosaic floors and ornate wrought iron conjured images of sophistication of an era long past. It was a pleasant surprise to see the many canine guests in the lobby at this dog friendly establishment. The size of room was standard for a hotel in a big city. The organza canopy that floated on the extra high walls and crown moulded ceiling above the bed made me feel reminiscent of a princess. The granite bath room was adequate, although the shower was superb with its massaging beams of water relaxing my shoulders! The his and hers substantially heavy cotton robes wrapped us in warmth and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great view, staff very friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: luckyBaltimore
Reviews.Content: Hotel wonderful location for museum and shopping. Staff very attentive. Room clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: RickeyD80
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right on the corner of State and Washington. Hotel is located 1 block from Blue and Red Line as well as from Macy's, Nordstrom, Disney Store and other shopping areas. Had a beautiful view of Millenium Park Amplitheatre and the Chicago Theatre. Front desk staff was very nice and room was more than I expected. Valet parking is a little pricey but the location can't be beat. Join the Kimpton Reward Program and get $10 mini bar credit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: SusanW0167
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I were struck immediately by the beautiful interior of this historic hotel. The service was friendly and attentive, but never intrusive. The decor was classic in blue and gold with an modern twist, which made for a very charming room. The view of the famous Chicago Theater was a nice surprise. We also enjoyed the complementary afternoon glass of wine, and petting the visiting pooches who were occasionally tethered to the front desk. The highlight of our stay: our three visits to the in-house restaurant, the Atwood Cafe for evening dessert, a lunch and our breakfast before checking out. The menu had a wonderful selection, featuring a great contrast of flavors at each meal. The mussels in a Pernod cream sauce was memorably delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Burnham Worst Booking Service Ever!!!! Would Not Recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: TimTurner123
Reviews.Content: I have never had to write a bad review based on service for any establishment, so this review should really come across as strong regarding service at the Burnham Hotel in Chicago. My issue revolves around making reservations for international guests and I was to book 6 rooms for two days (being a good customer). I never received any confirmations as promised and after the second day, I called and was transferred 4 times, cut off, and received a recorded prompt to leave a voice message. In a professional and courteous manner, I did just that. Four hours later, no call back from the hotel. I then called back on three occasions and it seems like everyone is a manager when you ask for one. Another important aspect of this is was the fact that I was booking direct through the hotel and not via a third party which can cause conflicts. I am shocked frankly. A four star hotel messes up reservations placed on a credit card twice. Then to top everything, when I went to book the rooms, the special group rate of $118.50 per room jumps to $190 and the arrogant representative on the line states, that is the best I can do. Luckily, I went to another hotel a block away, received rates for $90 for a better upscale hotel, and received an email confirmation within minutes. I am not sure why this happened and who is inept at the Burnham Chicago (A Kimpton Hotel), but never again will I stay at this chain. Brian

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: curlygirlyNE
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The architecture is just beautiful! The staff was very helpful and polite. The room we were in wasn't particularly large, but it suited our needs just fine. The beds at Hotel Burnham are WONDERFUL! They are very soft with luxurious bedding. This hotel is a great deal in a great location. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent alternative to chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: RedPooch
Reviews.Content: Unique hotel with terrific service. Very European feel. Worth it if only for the leopard pattern bathrobes they provide!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel.... comfortable, amazing view, aweseome location!”
Reviews.Author: jofish04
Reviews.Content: Hotel Burnham is a Chicago landmark. I've stayed in several hotels downtown Chicago, but this is by far my favorite. It's decorated beautifully, has an amazing view of State and Washington Streets and is in close proximity to great restaurants, shopping, and Chicago sightseeing points of interest. I will definitely be staying at the Burnham again!

Reviews.Title: “Check out the Burnham”
Reviews.Author: Brownsfanstill
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a weekend in Chicago and stayed at The Hotel Burnham. It was a great choice. We had a King room on the 6th floor. The room was small and quaint, clean, and pretty quite. The location is convenient - close to the Red Line and also good shopping/food choices. We didn't eat in the Hotel, but the restaurant was always busy. We did eat at Gene and Georgetti's - if you are a steak eater check it out. Will definately go back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel with fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: Tregilly_10
Reviews.Content: Hats off to Hotel Burnham and their exceptional staff. My sister and I have just returned from a weekend break. A special thanks to Duncan, who went beyond his role of general manager to accommodate our every need, he transfered us to a much quieter room on the 12th floor so that we would not be able hear the traffic below. He also recommended places to dine that were visited by the staff rather than tourists. A special mention to Vane who is very knowledgeable and a great asset to the company. The wine hour from 5pm to 6pm was a lovely addition to our holiday, as well as the free Starbucks coffee in the morning. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel, comfortable accomodations and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MO_Girl_STL
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a better hotel for our weekend in Chicago. Our room was very comfortable and nicely decorated, and the staff was wonderful. I brought a pair of earplugs, thinking it would be noisy, but I never needed them - except for one siren, we never heard any street noise. We will definitely stay there again on future visits to Chicago. Our only complaint was the expensive bar prices. We had some time to kill before our dinner reservations, so we went down to the bar and ordered a couple of margaritas. Had we known they were going to cost us $15 a piece, we would have stopped for drinks somewhere else along the way. For that price, I'd better need a cigarette and a nap when I was done...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: JonesFamilyUK
Reviews.Content: In Chicago for a weekend sigh seeing. Hotel has easy access to all main 'El' lines so easy to get to and around. Near shops, Millenium park etc, Rooms are not huge but nicely decorated and had everything we needed. Beds comffortable and planty of pillows so got good night sleep. The El far enough away not to interfere. Staff all really friendly and helpful. Nice touch was the wine evening from 5 to 6 each night, one down side is the lobby area is quite small so not many seats to sit down. Would certainly use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Ask For More”
Reviews.Author: dark2light
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Chicago and I based all of my research off of reviews I read about this hotel on Trip Advisor. My friends and I stayed here for a Winter Weekend Getaway and we couldn't have been happier. The hotel was near a lot of what we wanted to see (Millennium Park, Magnificent Mile) and if we couldn't walk to the other attractions the Blue Line was right around the corner from the hotel. The hotel is gorgeous, very clean and the staff was very nice and always helpful. The front desk answered many questions for us, always with a smile on their face. Our room was nice, always kept clean and in order when we came back. And we loved our Guppy. It was nice having one in the room. I def would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and pleasant hotel in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jeangrewe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights for my birthday this year. The staff were all friendly and helpful, and the hotel itself is lovely, and has a lot of character, with many charming touches that remind you of its former life as an office building. My 15th floor room was on the small side, but the decor and large bay window kept if from feeling cramped. The bed was comfy, and the room was very quiet all day. The location on State Street is within easy walking distance of shopping, the Art Institute, Millennium Park and public transportation. I would recommend the Hotel Burnham to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Ninjaneer1
Reviews.Content: My job takes me to Chicago frequently and after trying a number of the hotels I have settled on the Burnham as my favorite. While its central location makes it convenient, it is the hotel itself that is so compelling. Klimpton has done a great job of incorporating modern features, comforts and conveniences while preserving the charming 19th-century character of the hotel. The rooms are comfortable and inviting, the views from large bay windows excellent and the incorporation of historical details throughout most impressive. From Sasha at the front door to Lizz behind the counter and Ricky behind the bar, the staff is remarkably attentive, friendly and professional. The main restaurant is very good, with an elegant but relaxed atmosphere, excellent food and good wine list. Valet parking is fast and friendly, but expensive--typical of Chicago. Room rates are reasonable considering the quality of the experience. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A HISTORIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: BFLYNN013
Reviews.Content: Friendly service, accomindations were great. Our room was on the 12th floor, overlooking State Street. The room was very clean. The bed is small, but it worked. The maid service was very friendly. We were there to take in the christmas lights and store fronts. On Saturday when we arrived it was raining, the staff loaned us unbrellas to use why we were out walking. Sunday we were leaving late that night, they stored our suitcase for the day. I would stay at this hotel again. It is in walking distance of theaters, Millennium Park, Michigan Avenue, any place you want to walk to you can from here. I loved it and I thank the staff for making this a GREAT place to stay out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building, great location, helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LondonOzbird
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Chicago was made even better by staying in the Hotel Burnham. It's easy to get to from the airport on public transport and could not be better located for all the things you will want to see during your stay. The lovely Hotel Reception staff could not have been more helpful getting us restaurant reservations. The fitness room, while small, has all that you will need. The restoration of the building is documented in photos on display and it shows what an amazing rescue job was done to bring back to life a derelict site..

Reviews.Title: “The Burnham is tops in our book for a Chicago trip.”
Reviews.Author: JimsObie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Burnham this past weekend. A beautiful hotel that goes the extra mile in making a persons stay both relaxing and comforting. The staff was exceptional and went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed or might need. Most courteous and speedy check in, and out, I have ever experienced. The history of the Burnham along with being refreshinly clean throughout, and it's location the Burnham made our stay more than great. We will definately book our visits to Chicago at the Burnham again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Archtraveler_10
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel several times, mostly for business but my last stay was for leisure. To my surprise they gave me one of the bigger rooms on the top floor... it was excellent! the room upgrade made for a great birthday weekend... I even had a hand written note from the manager in my room when I checked in... The hotel is in a great historic building with all the charm one would expect... the only negative i feel i should note is that while the hotel is very clean and the service is top notch, the finishes are starting to look a little worn... the atwood cafe is an excellent spot for dinner. A little pricey, but very tasty...

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: Kcavs
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife, and two other couples stayed at the Burnham for the Columbus Day weekend. Everything about it was excellent! The rooms were spacious and comfortable, and the location was central to everything. The hotel bar was a great place for an end of day cocktail. There is even a 5:00PM free wine hour. Staff couldn't have been more friendly. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel---this is where I will always stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JohnnySong
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is a real gem. Excellent location (corner of State and Washington). Comfortable, well appointed room. Staff was excellent (hand written welcome note and gift left in my room). Wi-Fi works well and is FREE (requires membership in the Kimpton Hotels rewards club, which is also free). Even though my room was by the elevator it was still quiet from other guests. The next time Iâ€™m in Chicago I know where Iâ€™ll be staying: Hotel Burnham.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: Louiefromstlouis
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeds expectations in a variety of categories. The staff is excellent, the room is the perfect size, and the food is very good. The location is quite convenient. My only gripe and its a small one.....NO late checkout. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “The little hotel with lots of style”
Reviews.Author: Architecdt
Reviews.Content: Be sure to get a room with a bay window. Others are small

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: solorzac
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in down town Chicago. Always great service, the staff their are true professionals. It is most definately a must stay hotel - Atwood is also great

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: ROGUY48073
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago frequently and stay this hotel is my favorite! The location makes it perfect for shopping, going to the theater, walking to millennium park or running along lake shore drive. The hotel represents historic Chicago - it's charming, intimate and accessible. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the evening wine hour is a perfect way to end an afternoon of shopping prior to going out on the town.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: DGregory1
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel has a great location in the Loop. The property is smaller in comparison to others in the area. The blue velvet fabrics, pillows and window treatments are a little gawdy for my taste but it is in keeping with its historic past. I booked on a discount website then confirmed by phone the room would be a King and not a Double. At check in I encountered an issue with the front desk clerk that must have been having a very bad day(s). She was rude and impatient stating that the hotel could not guarantee a King since it was not booked through Kimpton Hotels even though it was confirmed at least two month prior. She stated that when a King became available I would be notified and could change rooms however the notification never came even though my stay there was for seven nights. The room and bath were very tight but comfortable for one. Furnishings were older but well cared for with a nice flat panel TV and impressive C/D sound system. The room could have used a good cleaning as spider webs were hanging from the fabrics over the bed and the bathroom had a musky smell. The property has one bar/restaurant that is quite pricey and has a small outside seating area on the sidewalk. Parking is valet only so be prepared to call for your car each time you need it. The subway 'Red Line' runs in front of the hotel and the train 'Loop' stops just a few blocks north. There are many places to get a bit to eat within walking distance and Millennium Park, Macy's, Museums and The Willis Tower are all very close. Other than the rude desk clerk at check in the staff was very pleasant and had a smile and greeting each time you entered or exited the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Artsguy07
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hotel Burnham three of the last five times in Chicago over the past year. It is, simply, the most charming, friendly and delightful boutique hotel of them all! We were fans from the first stay. The staff is extremely friendly and takes the time to remember our names (a very nice touch). We've stayed in a variety of rooms; from a room with a queen-sized bed to a suite. They have all been clean and tastefully decorated. If you're lucky, you'll get a room with a view, down Washington St., of the music pavilion at Millennium Park. It's pretty cool! Of course, we love wine hour every evening and the nice touch of a welcome gift since we are members of their loyalty program. The food in also "top notch"! We've dined in the hotel's restaurant, at least once, on every trip and we've never been disappointed! I love this hotel and look forward to my next trip to Chicago and staying at my favorite place in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Even Better than before”
Reviews.Author: dec140
Reviews.Content: I recently returned to the Hotel Burnham- and i am so glad i decided to opt for this hotel again. It's a great location and more to the point is a great little hotel. The staff are friendly and very accommodating without being intrusive. I really felt important throughout my recent stay. helped with all details needed to get around

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: MNTraveler13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Burnham for a recent business trip to Chicago. From the time I checked in, till the time I checked out the staff could not have been more accomodating. The hotel is located right across the street from Macy's on State Street and 1 1/2 blks from the El. I took the train from Midway and it was a short walk to the Hotel. The room was small, but well appointed. Appreciated the in-room controls for air and heat. Room Service was able to accomodate my request for something "not on the menu". Definitely made my trip very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jerhenn
Reviews.Content: Hotel Burnham is an amazing hotel. The location is perfect, it is clean and best of the all the staff are terrific. The complimentary Starbucks coffee, lemonade, iced tea, and wine were fantastic. Everyone at the front desk were extremely helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: redrosesue
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the Hotel Burnham location - steps from Milllennium and Grant Parks, the Chicago Theatre and the Chicago River. The history in this hotel is stunning and the service is top notch. Go for the King Suite and you'll overlook the skyline and enjoy the luxuries.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: BTEXP
Reviews.Content: I asked my family what they liked best about Chicago and they all replied "Hotel Burnham!" We got a great rate on a 7th floor room with two double beds. Yes, the room was small but that was not an issue for us. It was very clean with luxurious linens, great pillows and super comfortable mattresses. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. In the morning there was Starbucks Coffee available in pump carafes along with hot water for tea and iced coffee. In the afternoons there was home-made lemonade and iced tea with fresh mint leaves and a wine reception in the evenings; all available in the hotel lobby. The hotel is in a great location just a few blocks from Millennium Park and has been beautifuly restored to its art-deco splendor. I would highly recommend Hotel Burnham to anyone planning a stay in Chicago. We felt like Royalty!

Reviews.Title: “First Time Charmer”
Reviews.Author: ShaysWay
Reviews.Content: I took a chance on booking my stay for the 4th of July weekend at the Hotel Burnham. After a short train ride from the airport I found that the hotel was a stone's throw from the blue line. I literally only had to cross the street and arrived at my destination. The traditional decor of the hotel was fabulous. I loved the gate style on the elevator. My room also had a partial view of the lake. Being centrally located to the parks, theatres and shopping was the icing on the cake. This allowed me to connect with other friends traveling who were at other hotels (and also to escape from them at my discrection). The video cam in the lobby allowed me to send emails back home to my family of my daily happenings. By the way, if you go here and you need guidance on where to get the best deals on theatre tickets or running/walking trails (anything else for that matter) ask Tracey!! She was totally awesome. And for my nightlife tourguide was Liz. These ladies made my trip a total pleasure. I did have an incident with my bathroom upon checking in but, Mark, the housekeeping manager quickly resolved it to my satisfaction. I checked out some of the other Kimpton Hotels while in the city and this was my fav by far. I will definitely return to Hotel Burnham in the future.

Reviews.Title: “where Pets are VIPs”
Reviews.Author: ababychicken
Reviews.Content: Decided to spend the July 4th holiday in downtown chicago with our dog Jimmy. You would be surprised how few hotels will accept dogs. This one doesn't even charge a pet deposit! From the moment we checked in, we felt right at home. The hotel's decor is reminiscent of a vintage office building with the marble walls and wrought iron staircase/elevator facade. The rooms are very comfy and have chaises in front of the bay windows, making the room feel bigger than it is. Our view was right down State Street. The proximity to Millinium Park made our dog walks a pleasure and everytime we returned to the hotel, Jimmy got a warm welcome from the staff as well as the other guests. Would definitely choose this place again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms & friendly service - great value!”
Reviews.Author: Dora C
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a couple of my friends in a room with 2 double beds. The hotel is only a few small blocks from Millenium Park. It is a quaint old hotel with small but comfortable and clean rooms. They provide Aveda toiletries. There is a small gym or you can order a free yoga kit to do yoga in your room with the free yoga videos on TV. The service staff are friendly and helpful and they have free wine and iced tea or lemonade daily in the late afternoon in the lobby for guests and free Starbucks tea and coffee every morning. Internet is free, if you are willing to sign up for Kimpton InTouch. We paid $45/d for parking with in/out priveledges (valet) - which didn't seem to be much more expensive than nearby lots which were non-valet. We had brunch the first day in the hotel restaurant - food was good, but expensive. We got a great price for this gem of a hotel- $120CDN/night! Great value - highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Best treatment ever”
Reviews.Author: adapts
Reviews.Content: We arrived early (11:00 a.m.) coming in from NYC with temps around 90 degrees. They meet us at the door (cool lobby)with open arms. They took our bags and greeted us at the front desk with a welcome beyond belief. It would seem that my daughter in law had made them aware of the fact that we were celebrating OUR birthdays and upcoming anniversary. They said " happy birthday" to both of us and then listed several places that might be of interest to us. They also stated that our room might be ready earlier and it was but before that the bellperson stated that we should come back around 3:00 for something cold, it turned out to be ice cream, great . When we got to the room they had a bottle of wine and a note stating happy birthday and happy anniversary from the staff. The next 5 days we were greeted each day with something different. Sangria afternoon, Wii time , excellent room service with a small fish tank, little notes regarding our birthdays and other celebrations. Cozy- friendly- lobby. Help with information about the area, activities, they pay attention to every detail. The Room beautiful corner room where we could see the Bean and the Chicago theather at the same time. First time visit but would go back to the hotel in a heart beat. The Best treatment ever.

Reviews.Title: “A quaint stay”
Reviews.Author: TMont76
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was top notch. The employees goal was to make us happy and they did. It's a great location at the corner of Washington and State Streets - easy walking distance to Millenium Park, the Magnificent Mile, and other great shopping. The ambiance is very inviting and the hotel extremely quiant. Our fifth floor room looked onto State Street, so the huge Old Navy was a slight eyesore, but the sun streaming in was lovely. Yes the rooms are small, but all amenities (including Aveda toiletries) were provided. The Atwood Cafe was a great brunch place. I highly recommend the biscuits and gravy - it was yummy. Free Starbucks coffee every morning and wine from 5-6pm - all the little things add up to make you feel like a star at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerJoe
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Burnham. We love the historical character of the building. The room was perfect, very clean, with a comfortable bed. The staff was friendly and the front desk was very helpful with transportation and dining ideas. We will definitely stay here on our next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kmh1224
Reviews.Content: I cannot begin to praise the Hotel Burnham enough. The staff went out of their way to make my friend and I feel totally comfortable. The wine reception is an added bonus as well as the coffee in the morning. And the wine served was a very nice wine, not the crap out of a box! Later in the evening, when returning from dinner, I asked if there was a liquor store nearby to purchase wine. They offered me a bottle of the wine that was served at the reception earlier that evening. Then when I got to my room there was a smaller bottle of red wine and a Godiva chocolate bar. What more could you ask for? I have stayed in three of the Kimpton hotels in Chicago and have no complaints about any of them! I won't even start on the architectural signifigance of the building, you just have to see it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustForMe
Reviews.Content: I booked through Hotwire and got a great rate. Our reservation was ready for room 402, with a beautiful view of the old Marshall Field's clock at the corner of Washington and State. The room was beautifully decorated in rich blues and golds, with Aveda bath products, thick towels, and wonderfully comfortable pillow-top beds. Some Americans might consider the room small by US standards, but it is fitting for a historic and more European-sized hotel. The Atwood Cafe on the main floor is absolutely delicious. The antique wrought iron elevator and the mosaic floor in the lobby are lovely. Walking distance to all State Street shopping and Symphony Center. The front desk staff and doormen were polite and smiling. A great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Business Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: dctravel
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Burnham for a conference I was attending at the Palmer House Hilton. The hotel is in a great location at the corner of State and Washington in the hear of the Loop. Kimpton has renovated the old Reliance building and the work they have done is stunning. I arrived at about noon and my room was not yet ready. They took my cell phone number and gave me a call when my room was done (about 2 pm). In the meantime, I took a walk and had lunch. The room I had was on the 10th Floor and had a queen bed. The bed was very comfortable and I found the room easy to work in. The bathroom was the perfect size for a solo traveler and being a member of the InTouch program made internet usage free and provided me with a $10 minibar credit. Both mornings of my stay I had breakfast in the Atwood restaurant in the lobby. While I only had the continental breakfast (orange juice, coffee or tea, toast or pastry), it was served quickly and with a smile. If I had to pick something that was lacking at the hotel, it would be the workout room. Located on the 3rd floor, it was small and had only 2 treadmills, 1 elliptical, 1 stationary bike and some limited weights. I used the gym both days, but would have loved to have had a little more variety. Overall, this was a wonderful hotel for business and I would not hesitate to stay there again for either business or pleasure. Once again, Kimpton service exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A+ service”
Reviews.Author: BusyMom042
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hotel Burnham about 10 times in the last 2 years for business travel. Their outstanding service keeps me coming back. Every staff member at the hotel is geniune, pleasant, and went above and beyond to be helpful. An example was when the doorman asked me if I didn't bring my coat to Chicago because I was expecting warmer temps - when I responded that I forgot it in my car (which was parked by the valet), he responded that he would have the valet go and get it for me - 10 mintues later the front desk called and said they would bring it up. Just one small example of the "above and beyond" service of the Burnham. Beds are very comfortable, rooms are quiet, and nice Aveda products in the bathroom. A walk across the street to the historic Macy's is very convenient. My only small complaint (and very minor) is that the exercise room is fairly limited in equipment (one elliptical, 2 treadmills, a bike, and weights). Sometimes all the cardio machines are in use, which could result in a wait. I highly recommend Hotel Burnham and will continue to stay here for business.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: CleverScreenameHere
Reviews.Content: Arrival: Arrived late evening and was welcomed warmly by the front desk staff. Filled in on hotel amenities and given coupons for free continental breakfast at the Atwood Cafe. The lobby was on the small size, as is the cafe. However, it was clean and well appointed. Signs indicated that the fitness center was on the 3rd floor (did not check it out) and ice machines on the 2nd and 6th floors (also did not use). Room: Got to our room (#801) and found it clean and well appointed, we had a nice view of State Street which was fun for people watching. Wi-Fi was strong in our room and free if you signed up for emails from Kimpton Hotels chain. The (king sized) bed was very comfortable and clean. The mini-fridge was well stocked with goodies and even had some free items (tooth brush and tooth paste, etc.) available. Bathroom was clean and pleasant. Water temp. and pressure were fine. Our room was cleaned very well daily with maid service respecting the sign on the doorknob when we slept in; every staff member we encountered was cheerful and helpful. Other: The location of this hotel is AWESOME, a block from the Red Line and 1/2 block from several bus lines we rarely waited for any transportation whether we went all the way down to the Museum of Science or just up to the Hancock Building. The Atwood Cafe was excellent (try the french toast!), even the free continental breakfast was very good. Only two complaints - 1) The hotel does show its age on occasion, including loose plug-ins in the room, I was a little worried about plugging my laptop in, but nothing bad happened. 2) The Cafe and Bar close down pretty early, though this is not unusual in the Loop. You need to head north over the river for late night food or drinks (esp. on weekdays).

Reviews.Title: “pretty great stay- nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovinthesunLISA
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a really pleasant weekend in Chicago. I am from New York City and have never been to Chicago. There is lots to do (too much for one weekned) and it is a beautiful place full of nice people! I chose the Hotel Burnham based on trip advisor reviews and I liked that it was a historical building. The place is really beautiful. I loved our rooms. They may be a little small but I have never had a very huge hotel in the middle of a city before. The beds were really comfy and the ceilings were high. The room felt really cosy and elegant. Also at night you didnt hear any kind of street noise. Really awesome considering we were on what is considered a busy street! This hotel is in "the loop." Like I said I have never been to Chicago so I had no idea what all these neighborhoods meant. What was the difference between magnificent mile and the loop? or lincoln park? well... the loop is the business center/ theater center. it is also right next to Millenium park which is a nice place to walk around. chicago isnt that large so you can walk around to just about any area and the subway is really easy to navigate so that is a big plus. There was plenty of "regular" shopping such as H&M, oldnavy, walgreens, macys (marshall fields), gap, ny and co, and more. If you want highend shopping you go to magnificent mile. The staff was so friendly and welcoming. Reginald greeted us and after we checked in gave us the tour of the room! The staff seems small (which is a great bonus to being in a boutique hotel) because they all knew who we were and we knew them. They were all really helpful with recommending places to eat, calling for reservations, and giving directions on where to go. When my moms wallet was lost they looked up phone numbers of the taxi companies so I could call and see if it was found. The hotel has a small gym but it was up to date and never crowded. The restuarant Atwood cafe had very busy lunch and dinners filled with locals. We only ate a breakfast there. It was good and really pretty inside.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel. Clean, friendly, but not much for teens.”
Reviews.Author: AmazonKaren
Reviews.Content: Went to see Bulls game, and stayed here because of rates, ratings and location. (It was one block from the bus that takes you to the game.) Arrived, checked in and dropped off our car and went to catch the bus. When we got back, our bags were in our room, and our coats were hung up. Nice. Had to do connecting room, so it was one queen and 2 full. Rooms were smaller, but clean and nice. We got back late, and the restaurant was closed but the front desk recommended a pizza place nearby that did delivery. Said it was where the staff went when they got off work. Food was good and reasonably priced. Lobby is small, but staff was fantastic. Had a computer int he lobby for patrons to use. Located close to all kinds of fast food (for teens) and nice food (for adults). Very close to the train and bus routes. Great location overall. Hotel was small, and not much to do, but got a comfortable nights sleep, and bathrooms were pretty good also. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful international experience I would recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Janet_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Chicago on a much-anticipated vacation. The historical aspect of the hotel intrigued us both. After approximately 24 hours in transit, we were both exhausted and found the staff amazingly friendly and helpful. Our room, although small, was very comfortable and beautifully decorated - the photos on their website were spot-on. Free wireless internet enabled us to keep in touch with the kids back home! We look forward to staying at the Hotel Burnham again in 2012 when we make our next trip from Australia to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: elizabetherick
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation on Priceline (coming from a person who works in hotels, I hate expedia, hotels and priceline). I know that every once in awhile there is a problem with these sites and the reservations don't go through so I called to confirm and make sure I had a room waiting for me. I wasn't surprised to hear that they couldn't find my reservation. Martin was the gentleman that was helping me work through this kink. He emailed me my confirmation and I was all set. Upon checking in, the staff was super friendly and there to supply any information I would need and/or want. We got up to our floor and looked at the halls. It was gorgeous. Marble walls, doors that remind you of an old office building, it was just amazing. I looked at our room number, we were upgraded to a suite! We walked in the room and saw the view. There wasn't much of one, but it was still something and you could see the lake a little from the room. Waiting for us on the tv stand was a bottle of sparkling wine and a chocolate bar. The room was beautiful. The pictures on their website are truly what the rooms look like. Granted, you have to expect to have a small room given, you are in the middle of Chicago. I disappoints me that people wouldn't expect that. Nonetheless, it was a gorgeous suite! I honestly have nothing bad to say about this hotel. It is gorgeous inside and out and the staff was so friendly and wonderful! I would recommend this to anyone going to Chicago that wants a more personal experience!

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Chicago, love the view, sweet urban atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: mommy4eyes
Reviews.Content: I took my kids here and we all felt like royalty from the time we walked in to the time we left. Our room had a wall of windows, view of the lake, distant sounds of the El were soothing, and the doorman charmed my daughters with his eastern european accent and Dr. Zhivago black faux-furry hat. Aside from the room's size, unfortunately small, and the pizza, delicious but very expensive, I recommend this place without reservation. In fact, get the pizza. I can't remember the name, but it's the place where the counter staff eat and it was probably worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room!!”
Reviews.Author: SankIt
Reviews.Content: The room was way too small -- otherwise, a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: Louise_1980
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at the Hotel Burnham. I am a Kimpton member. The hotel sent up wine, chocolate, and a nice note. This time we tried a Deluxe King Suite. Very nice if you need extra room. Great view of State Street and the Pritzker Pavilion. We live in the suburbs of Chicago. This is our favorite place to stay in the city. They have great weekend deals. Check the website. Love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Architectural Gem, Hip, Clean, Great Location & Price”
Reviews.Author: Norge50
Reviews.Content: We once again recently stayed here in fall 09 and are never disappointed. In fact our rooms keep getting better. Great prices if you signup and get early deals. Uncomplicated staff and checkin. They let us check in early to a room that maybe wasn't promised to us, but same price and we were able to get out to enjoy the beauty of Chicago a few blocks away at Millenium Park. Attended a wedding a few blocks away and had a wonderful walk to/from the hotel. Did a package and got a great free continental breakfast. Will do this again. We live in the suburbs and this is a great location for people who come to enjoy the city.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait until our next visit”
Reviews.Author: guess2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Burnham on a Friday and Saturday evening while attending the Cubs convention at the Hilton. We wanted to stay somewhere withe more character and a bit closer to the restaurants of the theater district, and we were certainly pleased with our decision. From the decor, to the complimentary afternoon hot chocolate and evening wine reception, we could not have asked for anything nicer. We had a lovely time chatting with other families during the evening wine reception and our son was thrilled to meet their dog, a welcome guest at the hotel. The front desk assisted us with restaurant reservations at The Park Grill and we enjoyed ice skating afterwards. The rooms were beautifully appointed, and while they are on the small side, I think that is something that should be expected when staying in a historic building. We can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Delight”
Reviews.Author: kittyNewry_CoDown
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, classic hotel. Rooms and service excellent. Spotlessly clean and staff very helpful. The in-house restaurant was first class and I can honestly say I can find nothing bad to say about my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay in any other hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: parvarish
Reviews.Content: The guys were outstanding. Convenient location. They let us check out late (6 pm) and that too with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, friendly, well maintained, excellent service & food”
Reviews.Author: Dutchkids
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a beautiful historic hotel that has relaxed but professional qualities and excellent amenities as well as abundant character you've got to stay here! From the first time I saw it on Trip Advisor I fell in love with it. Hotel Burnham not only is a beautiful place to stay, but is in a great location as well. It's right in the loop and kiddie-corner from Macy's on State Street. It's only 8 blocks from Union Station ($5 by cab) and only 2 blocks from Millenium Station. Our room was on the 14th floor and had a view of Millenium Park ampitheater and the Chicago & Oriental Theaters and Trump tower too. During our stay we walked a few blocks up to Millenium Park and then proceeded all the way up the Magnificent Mile to the Hancock Building and back again in December and loved it! The key is to shop every block or so to warm up. :) Check out the pictures on their website and attached to this review - it's really as beautiful as it looks. The concierge was extremely helpful to us as we're from a small town and she gave us direction as to where to go or not go, what restaurants we might enjoy, where to shop, how to get around, etc. We relied on her completely and had a fantastic first time experience!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel - with some interesting twists”
Reviews.Author: Sails_Call
Reviews.Content: Fortunately we paid a fair price for this room since it was deeply discounted for our four night stay. The location is excellent, in theatre district, across from Macy's and an easy walk to the Miracle Mile and Millenium Park. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean, however there were stains on the cover of the chaise lounge. The hotel has the history of being a medical office building that was converted into a hotel. The coversion was done well and gives the small hotel a unique ambience. Each room had been a doctors office or suite (ask about the connection to Al Capote). As stated by previous reviews the rooms are small, and the bathroom lacks counter space. Small like European small. The hotel was quiet with a slight buzz of outdoor activity during the day as you'd expect in any city hotel. The bed was comfortable, and the room had a thermostate with a specific tempeture setting. The disappointments included a lukewarm shower each morning and a bad television (very dark picture on an old fashion anlog TV) which could not be seen unobstructive over your feet as you lay in bed. (I did not complain about the water tempeture thinking that it would be corrected each day). Yes they have free coffee in the lobby but for some strange reason it is removed prompty at 9 or 9:30 am, and there is no coffee in the rooms. They have a strange policy of hanging communal ladies under garments - leopard printed teddy and panties - in your closet for use by the guest. This has to be the strangest hotel perk I've ever seen. Who really needs a one size fits all teddy for a romantic tryst? The bell person assured us that it is washed after each guest (yeah, like that was my concern).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: grandmaPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 5 wonderful nights at the Burnham the location is perfect , right opposite Macys, bonus, and in the middle of the theatre district The staff are so attentive to all needs the rooms though a little small were spotless, I could not fault this hotel at all cant wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Great family spot and a great location”
Reviews.Author: VLR
Reviews.Content: Went to see the pre-Broadway run of The Adamms Family in November - walk to most all theaters from this great location across from the Macy's (OK, it's the Marshall Fields for those of us that are traditionalists). Great location and room was fine for a night with two teens - they're not huge rooms. We had breakfast down in the restaurant which was nice as well. Great staff - we have stayed at several Kimpton hotels and this is a top one! Consider this if you're going to Chicago and want to be right in hte thick of things downtown.

Reviews.Title: “A Small Jewel”
Reviews.Author: lscott
Reviews.Content: Our annual 3-day trip to Chicago, instead of the usual large Palmer House we chose the Burnham and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Room, the end corner on the 11th floor, was really small and oddly shaped; could see why, looking at architecture of the bldg outside. Good use made of the small space. Gold and dark blue scheme, beautiful window treatment, 3 mirrors, built-in night stands, large table and office chair. Closet with plenty of hangers, a safe, iron & board, animal-print robes available for use or purchase. Bathroom small and lacking in counter space but nicely designed. Lots of light, big mirror and shaving/makeup mirror. We really enjoyed the small cozy lobby with fireplace and Christmas decorations . Free wine hour (and coffee mornings) with other guests. Hotel seems very busy. Nice to see pets there! As others have mentioned, all staff super friendly and helpful. That $45 daily parking fee hurts but can be expected in large city, I guess. Hard to compare this small hotel with large hotel experience but we will certainly look forward to staying here again. Atwood Cafe adjoining lobby has eclectic dinner menu and always full. We had breakfast there, several steps above a corner bakery experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,amazing staff, the "perfect" hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PeterBcle
Reviews.Content: Finding a "pet friendly" hotel is hard enough - finding one that was a total delight is a dream come true. While traveling with our pooch Jack to Chicago, we had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Burnham... right in the heart of the theatre district, close to great shopping and fine restaurants... but it was the hotel itself that was such a joy. From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel so welcome. I have stayed in hotels across the country, Canada, and Europe, and I can honestly say I have never found a friendlier and more efficient staff. Add to that the cleanliness and classiness of the rooms and common areas, the fine restaurant in the lobby, and the ultra comfortable bed - and the Burnham truly is the perfect place to stay... pet or not!

Reviews.Title: “the Burnham, my kind of hotel; Chicago, my kind of town.”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandBob
Reviews.Content: What a delight to stay at the Hotel Burnham. Our stay was perfect from check in to departure. Tracy and Sara at the front desk, Reggie at the door, Christine at the restaurant, all went above and beyond to make our stay warm and pleasant. Our dog Jack was treated like a royal pup, every effort was made by the staff to make our stay the best it could be. I slept like a baby in the comfortable bed. The room and the hotel are spotlessly clean. The restaurant food delicous and don't forget WINE TIME every evening in the lobby. Just perfect. Can't wait to get back after the new furniture is in place in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at a historic landmark!”
Reviews.Author: merluza
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Burnham for 3 nights in September 2009. We won this hotel on Priceline and were very lucky with the Burnham. This hotel is just great: incredible staff, central location, amazing building. The Kimpton Group obviously did a great job in restoring this historic landmark! The rooms were smaller than average, but they were nicely decorated and added to the boutique atmosphere. We had a room on the top floor, overlooking the Chicago Theater, which was quite a view. We had dinner at the Atwood CafÃ©, which was lovely. Chicago's major attractions were within walking distance (The El, Chicago River, magnificent mile,...). For other attractions, public transport is not even a block away (red and blue line, and of course, the El). The blue line is the direct line to O'Hare, so we did not have to order a cab to get from and to the airport. This hotel was a great experience. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Business Travel Expierence Possibly Ever"”
Reviews.Author: wzaleski001
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through my company's travel website. The rate was about $225 a night. When I got to the front desk they told me that they only had a room with double beds left. I said that I would prefer a room wiht a one king size or at least a queen size bed. They said they were totaly booked for the night. Are they are told to say this? We are in a rescession and no hotel is fully booked for the night. They did not even have a r0om key for me. i checked in at 6:30 pm. Then when I got to the room the bed was literally 5 1/2 feet long. I am over six feet tall. I called to the front desk and against asked if they could please see if anoter room was available. "No sir I am sorry you will have to sleep with your feet hanging over the bed." was what I was told. REALLY? In addition, I ordered late night room service at 10:30 pm. They had a very limited menu - grilled cheese sandwiches on the menu. However, they didn't even have any one of the 3 items on the list. My only choice was a cold and soggy tuna sandwhich which was clearly over a day old. I ate it anyway and immiediatley began to get sick at both ends. My room was drafty and the noise easily wafted through the glass. The hotel gym is the size of a broom closet. The owner's should really close this hotel if they are not interested in running it properly. I am ashamed for this rat hole!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, attention to detail, scrumptious food, alluring scents and magical staff!”
Reviews.Author: vacationsurprise
Reviews.Content: Greeted by a classy and friendly doorman who was also attending the dog bowls out front, as pets are welcome though unseen. Every portion of our stay was carefully planned and pampering... from Reggie's informative guidance to our room, to the coffee and tea service in the warm and cozy lobby. The room decor created a feeling of royalty and the view to the beautiful scene below of the Chicago street buzz and buildings were perfect. My only wish was that I could have eaten EVERY meal in the incredible restaurant. Each flavor was a delight to behold and the staff followed the attentive care all the way through out stay. A true delight in sights, sounds and smells to nurture the soul.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sunshine3
Reviews.Content: It was perfect for our needs - and the service was unparalleled. The location was perfect for the theater weekend we had planned. Our room was lovely, if small, with very comfortable beds and a view of Macy's with its lighted Christmas windows. The desk personnel, housekeepers, and bellman were all very attentive - as well as the servers at the Atwood Cafe in the lobby. We walked to the Art Institute, Macy's, Millenium Park, two theaters, and Pizano's without difficulty. The El is only a block away. We would love to stay here again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great trip”
Reviews.Author: pchintawat
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago the last weekend in October. Yes, Halloween weekend. Not that that affected our review at all. The hotel is right in the heart of Chicago. Perfect location. It's on the corner of State Street and Washington. A couple blocks one way is Millennium Park. A couple blocks the other way is the Chicago River. A short walk away from the Art Institute. A couple blocks away from Metro and bus stops. Making the entire city easily accessible. The hotel room was great. We asked from a room facing State Street when we checked in because there is some construction across Washington. We got an end room on the 12th floor. Great view down Washington toward Millennium Park and also down State Street toward the Chicago River, with a view of the Chicago Theater. The room was a modest size. The bathroom was nice. One thing that we found amusing was that the shower head was about 6-7 inches above my head, and I'm 6'3". That hardly ever happens. The fitness room was small. Not much to it. There are two treadmills, one elliptical, one bike, and a set of free weights. It was a means to get our workout done. There are water and towels provided. The hotel restaurant was one of the better reviewed restaurants in the city. Some thing we didn't expect. I was recommended to eat at the Atwood Cafe and upon looking it up, I discovered it was at our hotel. The food was very good. Reservations are recommended. You can make those easily through opentable.com. Overall, we had a great trip to Chicago. And we feel this was due in large part to the hotel experience. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. You can't beat the location and service. And if you keep your eyes open for deals, you can stay here for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Inviting”
Reviews.Author: AngelaG2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Burnham brings life to a historic building. Room was unique and kept clean. Common areas were very inviting. Food in downstairs restaurant (Atwood Cafe) was excellent, but it was closed on New Year's Day and so we had to find another place to eat. Other than that, hotel stay was excellent and location was super convenient for seeing all the sights of Chicago. We would definitely return to this hotel and would certainly stay in another Kimpton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for Chicago Marathon weekend”
Reviews.Author: KCandAJ
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend staying at the Hotel Burnham. I was a particpant in the Chicago Marathon. Got a great rate on this hotel on Priceline (due to the weekend I did book about 8 months in advance). The staff was wonderful to my family and myself the entire weekend including providing my son with some free drinks while my family was standing out front of the hotel watching the marathon (the course goes right past at about mile 1.5). The hotel also provided all runners with a free breakfast the morning of the race and all of the staff came out to congratulate me upon my return to the hotel. The room was wonderful and the view to the north seeing the Chicago Theatre right up the street and the Chicago skyline was great. The buidling itself is beatiful as noted in previous post and the hotel does a great job of keeping the buidling updated but also appearing close to the original condition and providing a history of one of Chicago's landmark buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good staff”
Reviews.Author: phorrocks
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located centrally and it was easy to get to my client. The staff was generally knowledgeable about the area and gave good restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dec140
Reviews.Content: We checked in early with little expectations but were greated with huge smiles and accommodated immeditaley. The staff at the door and the desk could not have been nicer. The room although small was perfect and given it is an historic building -understood. Loved the Atwood cafe - wish more hotels had cool places like this to eat- Will definatley go again.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Place to Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: CaroleeD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real discovery! We liked staying there so much that it may be the reason we go back to Chicago again. A man we met on the elevator agreed; he has been staying at the Hotel Burnham for the past 12 years! EVERY time he comes to Chicago. This hotel is beautiful and comfortable. Everything from the personable and helpful staff to the complementary morning coffee and wine reception make staying here a delight. The rooms were awesome... complete with animal print terry cloth robes and yoga DVDs. The restaurant downstairs is excellent for breakfast, lunch, dinner and late night snacks (all of which we enjoyed while there). We had a corner room with a lovely sitting area and a view of Macy's on the opposite corner, and the park and lake several blocks away. It seemed that almost everything was within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “The best post-vacation vacation!”
Reviews.Author: mellosangeles84
Reviews.Content: Kimpton offered me a great deal for being a Kimpton Intouch member, so I couldn't resist the offer of staying in the historic Burnham Reliance building in the El section of Chicago. The location is prime. Walking distance to the Art Institute, two blocks away from Millennium Park, one block away from the Cultural Center. And the shopping, watch out! You're right around the corner from Nordstrom Rack, kitty corner from Macy's (Marshall Field), and across from Old Navy. From my window, I could see the Chicago Theater sign. After roaming around Eastern Europe for three weeks, I wanted to keep this trip low-keyed and slower-paced. Because of the location, I did not have to rush around and was able to do a couple of things a day at a leisurely pace and still make the wine reception at 5 p.m. The bed was comfortable and everything was spic and span. The staff was kind and helpful, and the lobby felt like my living room after a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Burnham is a special place”
Reviews.Author: Richard0304
Reviews.Content: This month marked my 4th stay at Hotel Burnham which has given me ample opportunity to make a fair assessment. The unpretentious staff has been consistently courteous, eager to please, and seem to genuinely want guests to feel welcomed. The hotel is centrally located in The Loop with Millennium Park and the Art Institute a short walk away. The physicality of the hotel stands out: it is stunningly gorgeous and its meticulous renovation (it is a historical site formerly known as the Reliance Building) shines. Elegant, exposed wrought iron stairs, marble wainscotting, and period light fixtures all add to its understated elegance. The standard electronic room keys were replaced by keys on brass rings. The rooms are attractive and spotless (many have chaise lounges in the bay window), cozy but not cramped, and are equipped with stereos, and, by request, a goldfish for the lonely traveler. The curtains are elegant, sporting excerpts from Mozart scores. Newspapers appear at your door, gratis, free morning coffee is available in the lobby, and there is a daily complimentary wine hour which features quality wines. Wake-up calls are performed by the staff rather than the electronic way, adding a human touch. The staff will also print your boarding pass! While the hotel is a quiet one (I am sensitive to noise), I would recommend requesting a room on a higher floor (above 7) that faces Washington Street since State Street often has street performing drummers. While I tend to dine outside of hotels, I found the Atwood Cafe in the lobby to be excellent with a creative menu. My four stays at Hotel Burnham have been consistently outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago At its BEST”
Reviews.Author: solorzac
Reviews.Content: In the heart of down town chicago! Shopping, parks,public transit and great restaurants(Atwood cafe was superb)at your door steep or should say at the hotels door step. Staff was excellent and super clean hotel. No matter if Im in Chicago for visit or business i will defiantly come back to hotel Burnham.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!! Absolute Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PatrickBuijs
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for one night (my last one when I was in Chicago) and got a room in this hotel for 129dollars (including cont. breakfast). I choose this hotel based on the reviews here on this site and the fact it is situated in a historic landmark in Chicago. I wasn't dissapointed! This hotel is very very special. Great, helpfull and very friendly staff but the big surprise for me was the room. I expected a normal room with a bed and bathroom but I got a suite. It was situaed on the corner and on the second floor. The room was very spacious indeed; if needed I had 2 tv's. A big comfy bed, de ceilingheight in thse kind of old buildings are alwaus higher then normal but here it was gigantic! Gives you even more feel of the space you got in your room. The free tasting of wine in the lobby (between 5 and 6pm) was nice for me, since i checked in between those times coming from Toronto. Friends of mine from chicago came to visit me in the room later and they were blown away by the room (even more so getting it for the rate i did!) Bathroom was of a good space and was very clean. Bath/shower combo isn't a problem for me. Situated near almost every subwayline you can wish for in chicago the location is just excellent. Even for shoppers since Macy is across the street! The lobby, elevatorsarea and staircase give it also that extra touch to the hotel. The free continental breakfast downstairs was good enough for me (I am not such a breakfast guy for that matter) but I would understand if somebody would find that a bit to little (although you can get extra stuff for offcourse extra dollars) Since my plane left the day after in the evening it was no problem to leave my luggage safe at the hotel after checking out so I could go around the city the last time before going back home!

Reviews.Title: “A bright jewel in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: DaisyVL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is styled with quicky 1920s touches such as art deco furniture, blue velvet music themed curtains/bedspreads. The beds are comfy, but do overtake the "single" king rooms. The bathrooms and rooms are on the small side - but I don't expect much larger when staying downtown in a city. The hotel is in a renovated bank building - so the elevators are a bit tiny and slow, but this is not a complaint. I loved the Kimpton touches: "happy hour" with free wine and sangria with Nintendo Wii in the small lobby, hot coffee or tea in the mornings with "to go" cups/tops, free wifi. The location is great - short walks to Millenium Park, the Chicago Museum of Art, subway and theaters. The staff were welcoming and helpful with directions, maps and suggestions. I loved my stay - would definitely recommend! (Look out for specials from Kimpton or other travel sites...got my room for $99 - can't beat that!)

Reviews.Title: “PRICELESS EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: Redraisinz
Reviews.Content: I must say staying at the Hotel Burnham really took the whole experience of Chicago up to another level. We just spent a long weekend in Chicago. As an architect, the fact that I am staying in the Reliance Building --- so brilliantly restored --- is a dream come true. It is part of American architectural history. This is one of the first skyscrappers in the world! The elevator lobby is a sight to behold. We stayed on the 14th floor. The room door had the original hardware. It is a very compact hotel, and the way spaces are utilized is very fascinating and efficient. Even though we were right next to the elevators, there wasn't much noise. We would hear the "L" go by, but that is lovingly considered as part of the experience of being in the center of the Chicago "Loop". Even little quirks in the room such as loose cabinet doors and bathroom doors that wouldn't close entirely didn't bother us much. We are within walking distance to many historical downtown buildings, and two blocks away from the amazing Millenium Park and Art Institute (with its new Modern Wing). The Hotel Burnham is rated as a 3-star hotel, although with all the history, charm, and character I feel it is definitely a priceless 5-star experience.

Reviews.Title: “All the good reviews are true!”
Reviews.Author: fleurr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Burnham for 8 nights as my bf works across the road and it was a GREAT place to stay...for an incredibly good price! The rooms themselves are nice,comfy beds,good views but fairly small. Bathroom wasn't too small to cope with. Nice aveda bathroom products too. We were on the top floor and everyone was absolutely lovely and always greeted us warmly no matter what time of day...you really can't beat it for the price! Really enjoyed the Atwood cafe too...but so did alot of people.It's packed in there! Location can't be beat....easy 2 blocks to milennium park,nordstrom rack right next door and state st macy's 10 seconds away. Plenty of food in nearby blocks too eg gold coast hot dogs,sugarbliss cupakes on wabash (best cupcakes ever!) and oasis felafel sandwiches! could not ask for better shopping location and Chicago is easy to walk...I walked to the mag mile quite a few times and it was a breeze. A few teeeny problems, most of which we only came across because we stayed 8 nights. They wouldn't give us a 2 hour later checkout (on a monday!)which would have really helped my bf out as he was stuck in important meetings and they weren't very nice about it. That was annoying.The tv kept breaking but we were told it happens alot and new tv's were coming in next year. The cafe closes at 10am on weekends for breakfast...10AM! This one only really annoyed me but I would have liked it if you could enter through the side doors instead of exit only...it was annoying.Another slight problem probably only affected the top level and that was tours coming through looking at the architecture...man that tour lady could yell! but it wasn't really a big deal...you just have to fight through a bit of a crowd to get to your room.. All in all for the price..it's a great deal and def worth a stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: canucktraveller83
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel - it was charming, well-kept and located right in the middle of everything! Very easy to get to from Midway airport (just take the orange line to Washington and walk a few blocks...looked like it was also easily accesible from O'Hare too), my friend and I hardly had to use our CTA passes! The rooms are a little on the small side - but you're not staying in a hotel to practice gymnastics now, are you? Most comfortable bed and pillows, and I was pleasantly surprised at how quiet it was considering we overlooked the busy street. You're right across the street from Macy's, the red line subway, a few blocks from Millenium and Grant Parks and near lots of theatres, restaurants and attractions. We did take advantage of the breakfast deal ($1 more a day) which was a good deal considering the continental breakfast usually goes for $13 I believe. It looked like the restaurant was generally pretty busy later in the day but we always got a table right away for breakfast! There's also coffee in the mornings and a wine reception in the evenings, neither of which we took advantage of (trying to cram in all our sightseeing took priority!). I wish I'd remembered about the "guppy love" program - you can get a fish to keep you company! It's a pet friendly hotel too - saw a few poochs while there who looked like they approved of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: DogPack
Reviews.Content: Was there for 2 nights mid-week on business. The hotel is historic and charming (real keys for the rooms!) with a very good restaurant providing prompt room service. Tho I didn't travel with a pet, I appreciate that it is pet friendly (and didn't see, hear or smell any pets during my stay). The location is ideal, Macy's, Old Navy, Nordstrom rack literally around the corner, and an easy walk to the trendier shops on Michigan Ave. Two or 3 blocks to Millenium Park and the waterfront, as well as the riverwalk, I had a great morning walk loop down State Street to the riverwalk, down to the lake and back up through the park. There was some construction noise nearby but not too bad. Only negatives were (1) a water leak through the ceiling near the door of my room, which someone came up immediately to address (and offered to switch rooms but I didn't bother) and (2) the bed linens were musty; I found out from the housekeeper that their laundry didn't dry them properly. This was a big annoyance to me as by the time I discovered it I was too tired to complain so just slept on top of the comforter, but the new sheets were fine the next day. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Friendly Staff, Somewhat Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly8
Reviews.Content: My husband had stayed at this hotel several times in the past but this was my first experience. The hotel is located downtown, within minimal walking distance to subway stops, the public Library, Millenium Plaza, and the Museum of Art. My first experience wasn't very positive. I had called to verify that a crib would set up in a room and I was told the reservation was only for two adults and that there was no way they could add a child to the room. The woman stated there were no other rooms available and it was against policy to put a crib in the room, yet after speaking to management they decided that by raising the room rates they could accomodate us in that room. In the end we spent 299.00 a night before fees and taxes for 3 nights and 209.00 a night for our final night. So needless to say I didn't go in thinking this would be a smooth visit but fortunately the staff that we encountered were all very friendly and professional. When we checked in we were actually allowed to go to our room early. The rooms aren't huge but it was larger than I expected. The building is a converted office building so it's architechturally very interesting. There are a few downsides to the building- the elevators are VERY slow and at night we could hear a lot of traffic and sirens coming from outside the windows. Forget renting a car and parking it. First of all there is nowhere to park downtown unless you are willing to shell out an arm and leg. It was over 40.00 a day to park at our hotel. It was much more reasonable to utilize the subway system and taxicabs out to things like the Shedd Museum and Aquarium. The restaurant downstairs frankly wasn't worth the prices. There are far better places to eat, all within walking distance of the hotel. You can sometimes print coupon deals off the Kimpton website to get the continental breakfast for just 1.00. Considering it was over 13.00 for a bowl of fruit, piece of bread and glass of juice the coupon is an excellent deal. The bartenders were friendly and the service was quick but it was 23.00 for one glass of Champagne and a small Bloody Mary- not including tip. Overall we were pleased with the hotel. The crib was very nice- it was an actual crib instead of just a pack and play. We did learn that some of our friends stayed at a place down the road that was just as nice and far less expensive so I do believe that next time we might have to check them out. It's a good hotel but I don't think it was worth $300.00 (after taxes and fees) a night.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: papertravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed there June 2008, loved every single thing about it, the service, the warm and accommodating employees, the location, the price. Lovely and special in every detail. If I ever get to go back to Chicago, I will be staying there. We never liked a hotel better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location--all the Kimpton hotels in Chicago are special”
Reviews.Author: joykenn
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Kimpton hotels in Chicago before and never had a bad experience. Their beds and linen are SOOO comfortable and, my pet peeve, they have a full size hairdryer , not one clamped to the wall! Tons of pillows, a goldfish friend if you want one or it is pet friendly if you travel with one. Mini-fridge in each room. Rooms can be small but luxurious. I've always found the staff extremely friendly. I like their free wine in the early evenings and good coffee in the lobby. This hotel has a fantastic location close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “The Atwood in the Burnham”
Reviews.Author: TheHandbagGuide
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such a jewel, and the Atwood dining room is no exception. Lovely high ceilings with vintage detailing, red settees at some of the tables along the windows, and interesting chandeliers. After settling into a window table with settee, which my husband sat on being taller than I, we were delighted with the menu offerings and very nice wine list. Great service, delicious and inventive food, all with a window to the bustling State Street crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Hotels never dissappoint”
Reviews.Author: 4_Travlin_Fools
Reviews.Content: My husband and I fell in love with the Kimpton Hotels a few years ago in Washington DC. The Hotel Burnham did not disappoint us. The location is perfect - one block to the Blue Line, across the street from the Red Line. Easy train ride from O'Hare to the hotel. The building is gorgeous. The view was great. The bed was a little slice of heaven. The Atwood Cafe has excellent food, and our bar tender, Doug, was wonderful. We are looking forward to visiting the newest Kimpton, Hotel Monaco, in Baltimore, and we are eagerly anticipating the opening of the Palomar in Philadelphia this fall.

Reviews.Title: “your own goldfish!! - the food from roomservice was to die for”
Reviews.Author: dataman2
Reviews.Content: very cute rooms, very quiet stayed in a king size, bed and linens were PERFECT eat at the atwood cafe while you are there the lobster ragoon was to die for, the mustard sauce, the plum sauce just wow!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: RonsterSF
